Reviews.Title: “Harsh reviews are unhelpful and misleading, this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLisa
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews (mice in restaurant, toilets smell of drains, noisy rooms, unhelpful staff, jacuzzi not worth the extra...) I almost cancelled our reservation before travelling last week. I am so glad that I didn't! The Hotel Vondel is a great little boutique hotel and does not deserve such harsh reviews. We are discerning travellers with a keen eye for detail. I had booked an Exec room with a jacuzzi (room 531). The room was on the top floor, which was perfect as we're not keen on having people above us.It was spotlessly cleaned, and thoroughly cleaned every day of our 4 night stay. The bed (two twins together, very typical) was very comfortable and the pillows were perfect, I usually suffer from a stiff neck in hotels but there was no problem here. Room temperature was perfect, but windows opened and there was aircon when needed.After a day of walking, the jacuzzi bath was fantastic and we used it at least once every day. Rain shower was soft, loo was spotless and absolutely did not smell of drains! There's no amazing view from this room, but you can hear the blackbirds and wood pigeons in the morning which was good enough for us. In the main areas, the lobby areas are quirky and comfortable for a pre-dinner drink while you're waiting for your cab. The bar and restaurant are tastefully decorated and again, spotlessly clean. As for the staff, they couldn't be more helpful. They booked cabs for us every night and served drinks (complimentary one if you book on line) with a genuine smile and excellent English. Our only comment was that you sometimes get a faint whiff of cigarette smoke. Not the hotel's fault, they impose fines, but some guests are obviously determined to break the rules. A quick blast of the aircon sorts it out. We didn't breakfast in the hotel, lots of local choice but our recommendations: turn right, then right again for Friday Next - organic eggs, bacon, fresh bread and juice; straight over and over the road for canalside bacon and cheese pancakes; turn right then left and look for the shop selling coffee beans and machines - excellent coffee and fresh muffins further back in the shop. The hotel is in a good area and we walked to all the main "sights" from it (comfy shoes and post-walk jacuzzi assisting). There's minor neighbourhood noise at weekends, but it is minor, and good natured. All in all, if you expect perfection you will always find fault (indeed some people seem to delight in doing so) but this is a well-priced, comfortable, clean and friendly hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the 'boutique' service.”
Reviews.Author: hybridses
Reviews.Content: After searching and planning a first time 3 day trip to Amsterdam with friends, based on location, value and look of Hotel, Hotel Vondel appeared to be the ideal choice. The hotel is located a few tram stops away from Central Station, so you can easily and quickly get to all areas of the city. We used trams and walked to all tourist attractions, restaurants and bars during our trip. When we first got to the hotel it looked stylish and chic, however after sitting in the foyer and bar area it quickly looked a but tired and lacked some TLC! Check in was quick and staff took our bags to a holding cupboard until our room was ready. All staff throughout our stay seemed friendly and helpful, bar one single member of reception staff who couldn't raise a smile nor look you in the eye when talking to you. He came across rude and uninterested. Quite disappointing really since his attitude overshadowed the rest of the staff's efforts. Just smile Maarten. The tired look and feel of the hotel continued into our room which was an exec room on the ground floor. Bad choice! Very noisy with footsteps and people talking from the corridor outside (mainly staff). It was room 130 - already mentioned in another review. The room itself was a lot smaller than expected and certainly smaller than the photo's on the hotels website. The furniture looked old and passed-it and there was little-to-no storage space for clothes. Bathroom was very nice however and bed very comfortable. Overall, a very nice hotel in a good location, but lacked the detail and the service that I had expected for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: gabrieldoming
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really Well located and design is nice, but my room was on the basement... I read the comments on tripadvisor about footsteps noise before leaving and I thought it would be bearable; it wasn't! On top of that receptionist were not clear on what was included with the room; I thought breakfast was included, finally not and at 20euros per breakfast, I found it really expensive for a breakfast where no more croissants were available at 09.30 in the morning. It was not a bad experience, but not a good one at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel close to museums”
Reviews.Author: marmaar
Reviews.Content: My husbond booked us a romantic weekend in November to visit the museums in Amsterdam. The romantic weekend included a welcome drink, an executive suite and a bottle of bubbly. Our first impressions of the hotel were very good. As we were offered to have our welcome drink at the bar, we deciced to have lunch there as wel. In the evening we even decided to eat at the hotel and were not disappointed. The food was very delicious. Overall we were very plesantly surprised how nice this hotel was. The only point of critisism was that the executive suite ( I think it was room no 130) was on the ground floor, in the intersection of a busy corridor, mostly used by the staff, and stairs going upstairs. It was VERY noisy up till around 1 am - 2 am. My husbond went to talk to the reception early during the first evening but according to them they did not have another executive suite available that evening, only the smallest room in the hotel. We did not of course want to change, having paid for an executive one. Next day while being on a canal cruise, the reception called us asking us to come straight away to empty our room so that it could cleaned and we would be given another exec room in the afternoon, we could leave our luggage behind the reception until the other room was ready. As we were on a boat, we could not return straight away and as we only had one night left at the hotel, we decided to keep the noisy room. If we had stayed for a week or so, we would definitely had changed the room, but saw now no reason for the hassle just for one night. So we declined. As we were later returning to the hotel, we found a bottle of red wine and a card from the hotel with their apologies for our inconvenience. We thought this to be a very nice gesture. Expect for the noisy room we cannot fault this hotel. Room and bathroom were clean, breakfast, lunch and dinner were delicious and the interieur is also very pleasant. We would return to this hotel but would make sure that we would get a quiet room elsewhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Had an upgraded room so was perfectly proportioned. Staff friendly and breakfast was lush. Overall a very nice boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and place”
Reviews.Author: Robbie22Manchester
Reviews.Content: Main criticism would be the size of the rooms. As they were also very dark with all the doors etc being black this made it worse. Bathroom and toilet were also very small. Toilet smelt of drains. The fittings were okay and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms were clean. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful although a couple of them seemed very inexpierienced. We did not eat in the hotel mainly because we like to try different restaurants. We did'nt have the breakfast as this was very expensive even by Amsterdam hotel standards. Very convieniently situated for the city centre. Overall reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Tatude
Reviews.Content: I did my research, especially on trip advisor, so I knew there was the risk of the hotel not pleasing me completely.....and that was the case! The rooms are small and packed full of furniture, depressing, and in need of updating in terms of paint, etc. Although, I was traveling with my children so I thought to downscale things, and don't regret my decision to stay there. The price was right, the location is great, and the hotel does have a good feeling in the common areas. The areas where I did have problems was the following: the reception staff cold & unwelcoming, breakfast expensive for what it was, wifi not free even in common areas (come on people!!), and I had a major problem to get my sheets changed. Finally on day 4 of our stay I had to throw a fit in the lobby with the management asking why do I have the SAME PILLOW CASES after 4 days. I started my complaint the first 3 times with the reception staff who treated me like I was a difficult client and they were rude....then on the 4th day I called in the management into the story. They were very surprised, very helpful, very apologetic, and had the situation resolved immediately. And to go further they offered us dinner in their restaurant, which is quite good, and the staff there very nice! So although we had some problems, and I was not at all impressed with the place.....it is well located and the hotel is not the worst I've seen. And not sure they deserve 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Made our visit great”
Reviews.Author: stasia t
Reviews.Content: Our stay was brilliant the hotel is lovely rite in center but just dwn nice quiet road away frm noise but it is perfectly safe..the staff are really nice and always there to help to get there take train to central station and tram 1,2 or 5 to leidisplein nd as u get of look to ur left and there a street straight over it just dwn dere.. the only ting we didnt no bout was we had to give 50euro deposit u had to give at start of stay for if u used internet telephone or minibar i wuld recomend tat u dnt use these cos very expencive if do room to room calls free.. the drinks nd food quiet expensive i wuld recommend u get tram to dam square tram 1 2 or 5 again food is lot cheaper.. overall stay was brilliant nt one complaint bout hotel nd we stayed in a small double

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but beware of extras”
Reviews.Author: juli-scot
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. Our room was small but having booked for a very reasonable price it was acceptable. The room was newly decorated as was the bathroom with beautiful tiles. Although very modern sometimes it seems they lost their focus on functionality. The tap at the sink in the bathroom leaves you little space to wash hands properly which was highly weird. However since we got the room for a good price we checked the guest information. To our astonishment we found the DVD player that you can lend from reception is 10â‚¬ plus a mere 200â‚¬ deposit. A bike will be 13â‚¬ plus a 500â‚¬ deposit. Although the daily charges are ok, the deposits are just extortionate! Also one evening we spent in the lounge area. One member of staff was asked about the charges for breakfast. I did not catch the amount but just heard the guest mentioning this is a very high charge to which the member of staff answered "yes, this is so the owner can buy another car." hmmm, nothing the customer needs to know, and seems like there are some problems between management and staff.. The housekeepers have always done a great job and were very respectful of the do not disturb signs.. I have eperienced otherwise before. I found the rooms to be very warm at times and leaving the window open is not ideal as there is a lot of noise coming from the street in the mornings. But all in all, the location of the hotel was great, we could experience the whole city by foot. I can recommend this hotel to people who do not have a problem with small spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars worth”
Reviews.Author: yasminr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the eleventh hour as i just could make up my mind on where to book and was just running out of time! As I had left it so late, I couldn't afford the rooms that were left in the other few hotels I wanted to stay in. Upon arrival we were immediately charged about 50 euros for what I understood after asking a few members of staff a safety deposit, i thought this was a bit crude to assume that we were going to damage anything! We were allocated room 204(?) it was midway up the stairs. The room was dark and a bit cramped, the bathroom was small with a tiny sink that you could hardly wash your face in. The more I looked at this room the more I wanted to kick myself for booking it. The walls were not insulated at all so being that it was around -10degrees outside you could feel a draft when you were near the walls. the lighting wasn't great and there was no cupboard for clothes. The hotel does have a restaurant(we didn't eat there) but it was nice and quiet at night so we slept well. Mornings however was another story, we could hear the buzz of breakfast service and all the guests walking up and down past our door....not a happy bunny. We found that the staff were not very friendly either and when i asked where Albert Cuyp market was the receptionist circled the nine streets???!! They barely cleaned the room and didn't replenish the tea/coffee sachets unless we asked. On the plus side, the location was very good as we were within walking/tram distance of most places, the shower was very very good and there is free internet. They did also leave a bottle of wine for my husband as we were there for his birthday, that was a nice gesture. Overall I would definitely stay in that area but not in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and great location , made first time visit very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Katie J
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfiend just returned from a 4 night stay and would definetley go back On arrival receptionist staff were more than helpful towards us , giving us handy tips and really welcoming, The room was very nice small but enough space for 2 of us but the amazing shower made up for it , the facilities in the room were more than handy eg - kettle , hairdryer and t.v The location of the hotel is spot on in a nice quiet street but 2 - 30minutes walk from main town deending on were you want to go We eat out alot of time but that was mainly because we were out early in day , but spent most nights in hotel as it was so nice, All in all a amazing hotel and very unique , everyone that works there were friendly :) Will be staying there again if we return :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent loction.”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: A central location, easy to get anywhere. Hotel staff are friendly, helpful and have good local knowledge. We did not use the hotel for food and drink more than once, has we found it be a little expensive for what you got with not much choice. Our room was fine and very little noise was heard. I would strongly advise using local transport for getting around, it is excellent. If arriving from schiphol airport, tickets are by the exit, from yellow machines, get ticket for Central station. From there, numerous trams go to the Museum quarter where the hotel is located. Travelling on local transport is very cheap in comparison to taxis and shuttle services. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend Amsterdam to any one. So much variety and many things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: Stars1105
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend and his father went to the Vondel hotel in Amsterdam in the middle and end of Januray. The first trip at the beginning was a little different. They accidentally didnt check us in properly and I guess checked other people in our room and while we were sleeping had come into our room. The staff immediately made it up to us with sending a bottle of wine to our room. The staff was so nice, all spoke english and helped us get use to the city. This location was great. We walked every where. No need for a taxi or the trolly. I loved everything. Beds were great, bathroom, and breakfast was good. Definitely would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “not coming back”
Reviews.Author: Wael2011
Reviews.Content: Vondel used to be one of my favorite hotels in Amsterdam, but with an internet that you pay for and it does not work for 3 days on the raw after a lot of hassle and connecting the guest to the internet provider (swisscom) instead of trying to sort it out, bad breakfast, bad breakfast service (ordered my eggs twice and they never arrived), paying lots extras to get a little bit better room and ending up with a very noisy one, for sure that was the last time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Canneberge16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Vondel 3 times already and found the rooms to be nice for travellers who enjoy a more local flavour rather than large hotel chains. It is built in old houses linked together. The rooms are not huge, and the iron needs to be requested at the front desk, but otherwise, a good choice in Amsterdam. For those who like running, Vondel Park is just next door!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but think you can find better for $$”
Reviews.Author: SallBell
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband recently experienced a three night stay at hotel vondel. On a late evening (10pm) check-in we came acrossed a locked door and no one on reception to let us in. After 10min and lots of knocking someone let us in. This isn't a huge deal and could be overlooked if our stay was a great one but sadly it wasn't to be. Firstly our room was large with lots of character which was great. But bathroom was a shoebox, bed was broken on one side (springs had collapsed), heater broke down, and bed linen was for a double bed when the bed was a queen. Maintence gave us a replacement heater which was great but we almost melted when the so called broken heater came on during the night. Staff were only so so with most appearing not to know what was going on. We also experienced mice in the restaurant with another family pointing this out to staff who didn't do anything. Overall this hotel was a below adverage stay with it being the worst of our European vacation

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Travelconstance
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice decoration inside, nice for lesuire holiday

Reviews.Title: “Nice reception/lounge, rubbish room.”
Reviews.Author: HoraceChestwig
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week. The entrance, reception, bar are all really nice and the welcome from the staff was great. But my room, I think it was room 12? was unlike anything I have ever stayed in. It was the size of a rabbit hutch, with a shower jammed in the corner which had such a low ceiling at one side that you cracked your head off the ceiling repeatedly. And I had bunk beds! I hardly dared leave the room in case I came back to find someone gently snoring above me. Note to myself - do not return or check the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived by the looks!!”
Reviews.Author: Edwardbostock
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in Amsterdam I came across this and thought that it looked good and was good value for money so I was disappointed when we arrived. When my wife and I arrived we did not feel especially welcomed by the reception staff, in fact I saw her disappear outside to finish a cigarette before we had even got in the lift. We had been told that our room was on the 3rd floor however when we got up there we couldn't, at first glance, see it. It turns out that it was on the stairs between the 2nd and 3rd floors - a piece of information that would have been useful from reception but we had to work it out for ourselves!! When we got into the room we came across what can only be described as a large cupboard. It had everything you needed but just no space. The bathroom was especially small for a double room and had no heated towel rail which would be helpful when you're encouraged to reuse towels!! We also did not feel that it was particularly good value for money. We had just been to Paris, Vienna and Prague and thought that this was the worst hotel by far. It was the only one where we didn't have breakfast - we could have added it but refused at over â‚¬20 euros per person per day!! The room was far smaller than Paris which is renowned for its small hotel rooms and was the worst value for money, which is saying something having been in Paris and Vienna, which are far more expensive cities. Finally we felt that most of the staff were very unhelpful and that they didn't want to waste their time talking to us - when we arrived we pointed out that one of the lights was not working and this didn't get fixed for our whole stay - which is a good example of how unhelpful they were. Overall we didn't have a good stay at this hotel. The one plus it does have is it's location and we couldnt fault the cleanliness of the room but the positives stop there.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip, all charges were supposed to go to my employer. They asked for my credit card for additional expenses and confirmed that the room was paid for in advance. A few days later they sent me an e-mail telling me all the rooms were charged on my credit card, even the rooms of other people who staying there and also were supposed to have their rooms paid by the employer. My employer tried to reason with them, they wanted to pay for the rooms and get things right but the hotel did not care, and did not want to help us out with this problem. I never claimed to be responsible for any of the other guest's rooms, which I still don't understand their reasoning for charging me with all of them. Of course my employer refunded me for the costs, but we lost some money since my credit card is international and there were taxes involved, plus the stress involved was unnecessary. Avoid this hotel. I know problems happen, but thats when you know if their service is decent or not. They did not try to help and did not care, which makes me wonder how they react to any one else's problems. Also the rooms were nice but too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DrunkenButterfly
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Hotel Vondel and our stay was nearing perfect. I'll start with the only negative I have about vondel, which was our sleep. Our bed on first look, looked absolutely perfect. It was big, clean and tidy. Then came the first night sleep on this gorgeous bed....However it didn't leave up to expectation. One was extremely disappointed...the bed as to go down in history as one of the worst bed I have ever slept on...I was so uncomfortable, it pained me to close my eyes. It was so bad, my partner and I contemplated checking into a different hotel. However because everything else had meet our expectation we decided against leaving and asked reception for a lot of cushion to sleep on instead....for the price we paid for it was slightly upsetting but we figured there was no point asking for a different room as they all probably have the same sort of bed in them. Other than this mishap, everything else was pleasant.The size of the room was a lovely surprise, we had the benefit of having a jacuzzi in our room, which was absolutely fabulous. We enjoy our stay but It would have been perfect if we got a good night sleep. The staff were very accomodating towards our request for extra cushion. Location of this hotel was also a great bonus...Loved being so close to vondel park and all the restaurants. I certainly would recommend to others as the bed situation for us was a personal thing...others might enjoy those types of mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: fgaliber
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the junior suite at the Hotel Vondel. Great decor and very spacious. The bathtub inside the room is odd, but very cool. The double-headed rain shower heads was a nice bonus. As an American, I was very disappointed to not have free wifi (which is common in Amsterdam), but there is a common-use laptop available in the restaurant. I was also not pleased that I had to rent iPod speakers, but at least they had them. The lift was tiny--barely space for 2 people. I really liked the lobby and common areas--very nice for relaxing and afternoon tea. The location was excellent--just a quick walk to the Fashion District, museums, trams, and Leidseplein. Looking forward to staying at the Hotel Vondel again!

Reviews.Title: “(Budget) Boutique Hotel Near Main Museums”
Reviews.Author: NasseNoff
Reviews.Content: There are some negative reviews on this hotel which seems to be founded an earlier management(?). Here is what you do not get: Big rooms and wide halls (the hotel is merged from multiple historic houses) with "standard" comfort (as in all boutique hotels showering spills water into the rest of the bath room) - Noise free: Some of the rooms are in the basement and the cars driving by outside may disturb you (order a room on the court-yard or at higher floors - or check in early). What you get: a hotel with good standard, nice design, a nice restaurant and bar which feels like a real local one (not a "hotel" one"). Very close to major museums in a very "real" area of Amsterdam. Very close to the Vondelpark - a major running/walking opportunity. Very close to a lot of shopping. What could be better: Breakfast was ok - not fantastic. Had a late check-out (10â‚¬/hour after 1pm) and the house-keeping kept knocking on the door.... Internet did not work well when I was there (VPN and Skype), but did not have to pay after complaining (maybe the major problem for me on a business trip).

Reviews.Title: “Good romantic hotel and good for business stays too”
Reviews.Author: DrHG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Vondel for two weeks when i started a new job in Amsterdam and on several occasions prior to that. The rooms are of good size with large bathrooms and on the 1st floor with small balconies which are nice. The hotel has a very nice restaurant and a bar called Joost which is worth eating at and hanging out in especially in teh summer when the courtyard is open. Staff is always friendly and service is very good. Higly recommend especially if you get a special rate. Very near the centre of teh city (3 minutes walk from leidseplein) but still on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: omoura
Reviews.Content: I tried to have an hotel that looks modern and is not too expensive. Vondel Hotel was perfect. Good location (near museums and near trams). Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Rooms were modern and confortable. Breakfast is good in a nice ambiance. We could ask for no more. It felt always good, when we arrived at the hotel. Pity there is no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK by European standards”
Reviews.Author: RicktoTangier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the museum district which is a short tram ride from dam square and central station and most of the city must see places. It is a small boutique hotel. They had free laptop for people to use in the back of the restaurant which seemed to be occupied most of the time.Rooms were very clean but a bit small. Reserved a jacuzzi room but it was not worth it. The gentleman on the check in counter was not helpful or friendly.It was not a cheap stay, more than 150 euros per night, so not the best choice for budget travelers.Bed was a bit too soft for me, felt like I had not a very good back support.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy stay”
Reviews.Author: wwrrkd
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, and the rooms are large and immaculately clean. They give you a basic breakfast in the morning. It is not a large hotel, so getting breakfast with the other guests has homey feeling to it. The hotel is within quick walking distance to a lot of museums (Van Gogh and Rijks), great shopping (from designer to souvenir shopping, and the Heineken Factory. Definitely check out he Heineken Experience, it is totally worth it! But really you can walk anywhere from the hotel. Lots of places to eat nearby, a few bars, and a few coffee shops. We had a lovely stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: silvergirlpink
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, great location, very clean and tidy and friendly staff. The bed was comfortable and nice to have a fridge. Really enjoyed our stay here, made better by the fact my boyfriend proposed in the hotel room! Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: kiki69London
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel in a bit of a rush, I needed a hotel close to the Rijks Museum in Amsterdam and this seemed to check all the boxes. After I had already made the booking I read some of the not such nice reviews on this website so I was prepared. Anyway, when we arrived we were shown our room, I had booked a small double and asked for a bathroom with bath, the room was ok, very tiny indeed but unfortunately no bath but only shower. I asked the girls behind reception if they did have a room available with bath, they checked it out and we were offered an other room this time with bath so I was happy :-) I really liked the energy of the hotel, staff were very helpful and friendly plus relaxed. It was a young and kind of trendy place, my parents, who are in their seventees, probably wouldn't like it too much but we did. Staff spoke English very well, some of them no Dutch but I wouldn't say that was a problem. The beds were comfortable, location very good. We didn't have brakfast but what I could see that looked nice, the breakfst area is very nice at least and I did get a complimentary coffee when I was waiting for a taxi to the airport and I had already checked out, which I thought was nice too. All in all, I would reccommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, worth the stay.”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: This is a great bouquet hotel with super friendly staff. The rooms are well done and a good size for Amsterdam. For those who complain about the size have really not had a small room in Amsterdam. The rain shower is really fun and the bathrooms are nicely done even if sometimes they look a little better then function, artistic for sure. The one down fall was the pillows in the bed, which every detail is taken care of but the pillows were awful. They seemed like it was stuff with random pieces of foam which made it super lumpy and odd to sleep on. The hotel is nice walking distance to a whole bunch of places and though not centrally located is a perfect location for those who don't want to be stuck in the center of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BroadmeadTraveller
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is perfectly situated near the museum, the canal boat office, great restaurants, the shopping district and a casino. The rooms are quite tiny and not cheap. The staff at the hotel were ALL very courteous, helpful and just great to deal with. You have to realize that you are in Europe and can't expect to find NA prices and conveniences. I would stay in this hotel again and again.\

Reviews.Title: “Great city location!”
Reviews.Author: mowhop
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Vondel for a girls shopping weekend. Overall had an excellent stay, particularly as the location was perfect for finding good bars, restaurants and shops less than 10 minutes away; you are also perfectly placed for canal boat tours and museums. As other reviews state, rooms are very small, as are single beds in twin rooms .... careful not to roll too far and walls very thin as my friend and I found out at 6.45am when our next door neighbour was enjoying a very noisy conference call!! However, rooms were clean and bathroom stylish .... would recommend hotel added some additional lighting to room as was a bit dark in entrance .... not easy for blowdrying hair and finding clothes in wardrobe! Although I have only given an average rating, would definitely use hotel again as location was great and hotel good enough, though advise not bothering with breakfast which was very average and expensive if not included ... there are plenty of other cafes offering better! If you are thinking of a stay in Amsterdam, go for it, its a really cool town and there's literally something for everyone and shopping is excellent .... shoe shops plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: Anaxagoras1
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very clean hotel. Convenient location. Cons: The small double room that we booked was really tiny. Also, charging 10 euros per day for internet is way too much!

Reviews.Title: “we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: delb623
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. The rooms are small by U.S. standards but VERY comfortable! The bed was comfortable. It is air conditioned which was important to us - it was very warm when we were there. The garden is a nice addition. The location is great - a very short walk to Vondel Park, the Rijksmuseum, the VanGogh Museum, a tram stop, and the Leidseplein with many great restaurants. Breakfast is nice - we ate here one morning - but terribly expensive. Walk across to the Liedseplein for less expensive choices. Out only issue was that they "serviced" the rooms late in the day the last couple of days. We did not complain so I can't say if that would have improved.

Reviews.Title: “I would return”
Reviews.Author: eagleleader
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean... bed comfortable .... shower had plenty of hot water if you know how to set the knobs .... staff was great and Ms. Susan was awesome. had plenty of info to share at the front desk and always had a smile on ..... we didnt eat there but the cafe was crowded on the weekend ....if there are 2 of you and you want to be off to the side ask for room 535. the area its located in was very easy to get in and out of .... made the trip the best .... if you want a nice room with everything you need then stay at the Vondel ,,,, we called it home while we were there

Reviews.Title: “worst 10 days of my life”
Reviews.Author: DivineVee
Reviews.Content: I will start with the only positive thing about this hotel: the location, it is next to the park, a walking distance from museums and Leidsplein. However, I would really advise people to think a million times before booking in this hotel. especially if they use their credit card. I just got back yesterday and it was a terrible experience. I booked 3 rooms with them: 2 refundable and 1 non refundable. They withdrew the entire amount of money for two rooms and blocked 400$ for the third room of my friend's. When my friend found this out, he cancelled his booking, and they told him his money will not be refunded before a month. As for me and my sister, we decided to go ahead and stay there. When we arrived, they said that they will refund us the total amount of money for the 2 rooms, and we pay the full amount when we check out, they didnt of course. I called my bank a day before i checked out, and nothing was refunded. To my bad luck, i was required to stay in Amsterdam for 2 extra nights for business reasons, so Vondel told me that those 2 extra nights will be for 400 Euros for each night, and after a lot of bargaining, yes bargaining! they lowered it to 320 euros and asked that i pay the 640 euros on the spot, which i did. Then when i checked out, they INSISTED that we pay the full amount for the two rooms again! After endless arguments and embarassing scenes at the reception in front of everyone, they gave me the low down and told me i dont have a choice and forcefully withdrew the amount from my credit card as they have all its details! This was one of the worst experiences of my life, and i wish my stay there was worth it, the rooms are tiny and you have to pay a small fortune to get a room that costs half price in any other 3-4 stars hotel. The housekeeping is crap: they rarely change the towels and emptied the trash twice during my 10 days stay. The staff is very inexperienced, they have several interns & those were the best of the whole lot, we had to go and beg the manager a couple of times for someone to change our towels in the bathroom and still they did nothing. The food is average, and they charge you half the price of your meal for bringing the food to your room. The internet is for 10 euros a day, and it operates on 1 device only, so if you are a couple, then you have to pay 20 euros for a daily use of the Wifi. The walls are very thin, there was a room full of kids next to my sister, and she couldnt sleep for 3 nights because of the noise they made. I could go on, but writing this review gives me the shivers as it reminds me of the worst 10 days of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Just A Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to Amsterdam for my birthday last month and we stayed at this absolutely charming hotel. From the minute I walked through their doors I knew we were in for a treat. My first impression proved very accurate. The service, our room, breakfast, their garden and the atmosphere were all top notch. The hotel is also located close to everything...... museums, shops, Vondel Park, markets, etc. I was very impressed all-around and will undoubtedly make Hotel Vondel my home whenever in Amsterdam! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UyenHuynh
Reviews.Content: I stayed alone at the Vondel Hotel last weekend. It was a last minute booking. I booked the last available executive room, but got an upgrade to the apartment! The receptionist was very helpful and the staff very polite. The hotel was stylishly decorated, the bar offered a cosy place for a drink and the breakfast was fine. As a single female 'travelling alone' this could not be a better place to stay! To me, it was for only one night, but I would definitely return the next time! (please note that I had lived in Amsterdam for 15 years, I am a decent traveller and I have seen a lot. It is what you are used to, but the Vondel Hotel is simply great!) Uyen Huynh

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Paula P
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel Vondel to celebrate my boyfriends birthday! Everything was perfect. Very nice room, we got a free upgrade to a room with a jacuzzi. The staff was very helpfull and advised us a very good restaurant for the saturday evening. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and incredibly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DawnandPaulinLeeds
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vondel is ideally located - close to the Leidesplein (a central square), but far enough away not to be affected by the noise from the bars, trams or passersby. It is also very close to the beautiful Vondel Park. When booking I had requested a quiet room and was very pleased to be allocated one which overlooked the garden at the back of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. In fact, as a result of the comfort of the bed and the quietness of the room, the four nights that I stayed at this hotel were the best nightsâ€™ sleep that I had had in a long time. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for them. I made an unusual request to the hotel manager who put himself out significantly in order to fulfil it and to ensure that the reception staff were also kept informed about it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Romantic Week”
Reviews.Author: paulandjacqui
Reviews.Content: I cannot Imagine any negative comments on tripadvisor about this Hotel. Me and my girlfriend were having a great stay!! The hotel is found on a great location in the centre of amsterdam nearby leidse square. the staff was friendly to book restaurants for us and gave us directions to the many nice areas the city has to offer. One day it rained so we stayed in for dinner and in the nice d restaurant. The whole atmosphere this boutique hotel including restaurant is breathing trendy but also relaxed. They spend a lot of time in the design and selcting art (loved the dog) also in the rooms. All in all we had a geat stay. thanks again Hotel vondel and until next time

Reviews.Title: “Tiny people only...”
Reviews.Author: NewbieGulliver
Reviews.Content: Our hearts sank the moment we open the room door. The room was extremely small. There was no walking space. Throughout our stay, we had to jump over our suitcases on the floor, or trip over them. The sink was cool designer style. But it was so shallow that it's not possible to fit your hands underneath... Stupid design...

Reviews.Title: “Average At Best”
Reviews.Author: Debzlou
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business - upon checking in, the receptionist told me I had been upgraded at no extra cost! I was very excited by this - however less so when I got to my room, which was in the basement. It was a decent size, very clean with a nice bathroom, however very little natural light, and the desk lamp didn't work. The two "windows" were close the ceiling and as it was so hot (and there was no aircon) I opened them - only to have my room then smell of smoke from the smokers on the path outside. If I hadn't already unpacked all my stuff by then, I would have requested a different room! So I shut the windows and the staff very helpfully brought me a fan. I ordered room service, which arrived within the stated timeframe and was of OK quality - but the menu itself was pretty limited. On the plus side, they were very quick to exchange the wrong drink that they had brought down. Breakfast was good and I thought the dining room was pleasant but the chair I sat in was just a fraction too high. I had wireless internet in my room which I didn't think was free, but I didn't enter any credit card details and it wasn't on my bill when I checked out either. So maybe it was :) I'm not sure I would stay here again as I'm sure there are nicer hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Rediculously priced 'guest house'”
Reviews.Author: stopo
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is now one big tourist trap and the vondel is intent on getting it's share of that market. Rooms come at 139 euros/night, excluding breakfast. I was originally given a room on the 4th floor (attic) which was very small and had a bathroom built into a cupboard. The bathroom was windowless and so small one had to open the door in order to physically turn around. I complained and was moved to a normal sized room after a discussion around the point that such 'attic' type rooms were typical of 'boutique' hotels. It is is this sort of hotel that 20 years ago would have been a guest house charging a fraction of the price. On checking out an 80 euro charge appeared on my bill for early 'book in', which I had not had and they subsequently removed it. But it was interesting to know that the hotel charges 20 euros per hour if you check into your room before 3.00pm. What happened to customer service when you could check into your room when it was ready. What else was the Vondel planning to do with it? Not all things are chargeable at the Vondel; watching the mouse scurry across the dining room floor was complimentary! If you don't mind paying these prices..then go to a proper 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - moderate service - poor room”
Reviews.Author: svalkenborg
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel when amsterdam had a heatwave(35Â°C in the evening) Check in was very quick, no questions, they ask you just name, that's it(no more - no less). They don't ask you if this is your first time, no welcome drink, etc. The kind reception girl told me my room was at the second stairway case down. I though a room in the basement. To my surprise, when opening the room, the room had an enjoyable atmosphere but no airconditioning, no remote control for the TV, bathroom's floorheating couldn't turn off (with 30Â°C in room) and the bathroom had an unpleasant smell. Next morning, i was out again. Checl out very smooth, no questions, no advise, just pay and bye bye. Price wise this hotel is ok, but do not expect high service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: seanpaultaylor1964
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Tiny rooms, no ventilation in toilet- disgusting, couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom. Lack of ventilation in whole hotel. One day our room didn't even get made up and I was told housekeeping finish at 1700hrs. Breakfast an absolute rip off at EUR19.95. No cooked breakfast in buffet area, no hot water to make your own tea with a tea bag in a lousy glass cup. I could go on, but my advice is don't stay at this hotel. It isn't even cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Greet location, lovely decor, very rude receptionists”
Reviews.Author: travelnati
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in June and initially loved it, the rooms are specious and nice, the hotel is located in a quiet street only one block from leidseplein, a very central square. We were however struck with how RUDE the receptionists were- already a arrival they were rather harsh and unfriendly, and when we came in one day in the evening and our beds had not been made up she blamed us and then continued stating that she was just the receptioninst and had no idea- very unprofessional. For the rest the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: angle13_11
Reviews.Content: No way near 4stars. Overpriced for accommodation. We were up in 411 in the attic reached by either very narrow twisty staircase or teeny weeny lift. It was like living in a shoe box for 5 nights. The bathroom area to stand in is no bigger than my tiny downstairs loo at home (3'x4'). Lost count how many times my hubby banged his elbow drying himself in the morning. It must get unbearably hot up in the attic rooms in the height of the summer months as there is no air con - but they do provide a large fan! The walls are so thin and I am a very light sleeper and was kept awake til 4 am one night by two dutch ladies competing against each other in who could talk louder over each other without drawing for breadth. Our view in the loft was of next door's pantile roof. I could not tell what the weather was like til I went down for breakfast. It was a special celebration for both our 50th birthdays and cost a fortune. With hindsight we should have complained and requested to be moved. Breakfast was OK so on my birthday my treat was pancakes which was the best thing of our stay. The staff in the bar/dinning room are inexperienced and shorthanded, always offered more coffee at breakfast but would forget to come back with the pot! Got peed off with the business men having business meetings at the breakfast tables (loudly) when there were so few tables in the first place to cater for the number of guests. Ideal location away from the noise of the main route of trams and buses but try the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls, no sleep first night”
Reviews.Author: tsjakka
Reviews.Content: It's a nice boutique hotel, convienent in the center of Amsterdam. They put me in room 207 which is very, very small. No space between bed and small desk. No airco and, how nice, paper walls between room 206 and 207. The TV set of 206 was playing so loud I thought it was the TV on my room at 3.00AM... I complained and the nightporter sorted it out, but the guest received two phone call that night at 4.00 and 6.00 am... Nice bar, nice breakfast. Next time ask for a large suite on the roof, a collegue of mine was lucky to have one of those....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: intl806
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel, awesome location near museums and restaurants. Drawbacks: no WIFI but there is one PC available for guests to use and they will allow you to print your boarding passes. Rooms are smaller than seem to appear pictures, but the place is clean and modern in the converted three old buildings which make up this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “avoid avoid avoid!”
Reviews.Author: L0ttie06
Reviews.Content: - Noisy room - no sleep - Blood stains on the wall in new room when moved.. - is a shabby 2* as decor is tiered. - Double room booked - got a twin. - Rude receptionist upon check out - called me a liar and demanded we pay for breakfast when we had not eaten there! - Attitude from staff when no coffee/tea left in room - plus Only 1 mug! - No communication between staff. - Our luggage got lost! Stayed 3 nights here. The room seemed okay until we TRIED to get to sleep. Even with ear plugs in we couldn't sleep as our room was below the bar with a fire escpae right ourside/above our window. Every 5 mins poeple were coming out for cigarettes so no sleep and couldn't even have a window open. Then at 4.30am they began preparing for dinner At 7am I went upstairs to complain and the chap at reception was VERY helpful I have to say! When i mentioned the room I was in he smiled to himself and appologiesed and said that we would be moved. So we left our bags in our room and went out, came back at 1pm when we were told our room would be ready but it was not - this was ok as we went out again for the afternoon. We returned at 6pm and the receptionist had NO idea that we were being moved and advised that she couldn't find a room as everyone had checked in so we would have tio stay where we were - then the concierge checked our original room and our luggage had been m,oved - it took the receptionist 30mins to sort this out and she when I explained I was tiered after NOT sleeping the night before - she TOLD me "well I can't find any information here so just wait ok." When we got to our new room I was so tiered I went straight to bed for a few hours. Then went out for dinner and noticed that a bottle of red wine had been put in our room - this was a nice gesture I thought (don't drink red but even so I was impfressed!) THEN.... I noticed the blood on the walls just outside our room! Ah i could go on and on as I was made to feel like I was an inconvenience being there and it just wans't nice. When we checked out we had breakfast on our bill which we had not had and when disputed this was made to feel like we were trying to get out of paying. When I mentioned I work in the travel industry she did not care!!! Funny though as I will NEVER send my clients there I have never experienced such bad manners and bad communication!! Stay at another hotel in the area - The Best Western is next door and the marriott down the road!! AVOID AVOID AVOID - is a shabby 2* as decor is tiered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; quirky building; service of uneven quality”
Reviews.Author: memofromistanbul
Reviews.Content: The positives: 1) central location, 2) romantic courtyard restaurant, 3) free use of a laptop (even though it is in a corner table in the restaurant and usually occupied) 4) an upgrade to a considerably roomier executive room at 20 euros per night as the normal room was too small. The negatives: 1) noise from the courtyard (mostly staff out for a quick smoke) 2) the sink in some rooms was less than 10 cms from the end of the faucet to the bottom of the sink! It's difficult to get all of your hands under the faucet, especially for a big person. 3) service was of uneven quality - the front desk and the restaurant had some very positive & attentive people and some that were sulky & some with an attitude; my guess is that there is a lot of turnover and no hotel-wide quality standard can be implemented. Also, keep in mind that some rooms are split level. My friend's 75-year old Mom was initially placed in such a room with very steep steps, but the hotel helpfully assigned another room for her.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, without the Chic”
Reviews.Author: sle93057
Reviews.Content: We arrived after an extended trip that included my exchange daughter from fourteen years ago's wedding in Germany. She had booked the hotel saying a friend had stayed here and loved it. She and her new husband came with me and my husband for the first part of their honeymoon. When we arrived, the first thing that caught my eye was how filthy and run down the lobby was.I was afraid to sit on the couch. Not what I expected in a four star hotel. The unprofessional woman at the front desk told us we would have to wait while they got the rooms ready, despite this being at almost five pm. When we did go up to the rooms there was a mix-up and my husband and I were placed in the standard room although we had booked the "Executive Suite." I took one look around the tiny room with hideous decorations and said I could not stay. The woman at the desk recognized it was the wrong room category and said they only had one executive suite left and showed us a room below street level. I said that wasn't satisfactory. She said we could complain the next day when a manager would be in. This was on a Monday! After much more back and forth a manager finally showed up and got us into a better, although still ugly, room.How they could call this an executive suite I don't know. There was no free internet and not a real sitting area or desk. On top of this, we had requested flowers and champagne to be placed in our friends room as a honeymoon surprise and this had not happened. After this horrendous beginning, things did improve. The people at the front desk from that point on were friendly and helpful. The sheets and towels were always clean and fresh and the mattress was comfortable. Our room averaged 170 euro's per night. For that they did not provide breakfast. You had to pay an extra 20 euro's for their mediocre buffet. They did give us breakfast for free one day in compensation for the room mess up. You also had to pay extra for in room internet access. Our faucet in the sink only gave out warm water, never cold. The design of the sink was so poor it was ridiculous. To be fair, I think I usually stay in a bit pricier hotels and I always use Trip Advisor. I held some responsibility for this poor choice by letting my young friend decide on the hotel. It was her honeymoon and the sad thing is I cannot imagine a less romantic place to spend it. Luckily, she went on to Paris and had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient, but with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: TheWisslers
Reviews.Content: Service was good and the location was quiet and very convenient to the museum district, but still within walking distance of other areas. The room was very stylish-looking and the bed was comfortable, but there were no drawers and a short person could not reach the hangers for clothes. There was only 1 TV remote for 3 TVs, and it would not turn them on, only off. We never succeeded in getting a pay movie. (Just as well, maybe.) Most importantly, between the bed and the bathroom were 5 wooden steps with no handrail. So if you're concerned about that, you should ask before accepting a room. I guess they are all different, as the hotel has been made from several old houses put together.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely unpleasent experience!”
Reviews.Author: jugjugs62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had high expectations for this hotel but were deeply disappointed! Upon arrival we were informed that our room wasn't ready yet and that we were welcome to sit and wait, for how long, we weren't informed! After what seemed like a lifetime we were told our room was now ready. The room was minuscule to say the least and it was apparent that the cleaning had been a rushed job. The next morning we went down for breakfast and it was very chaotic. It seemed that the restaurant/breakfast area was too small for the amount of guests the hotel had. There were not enough members of staff working to help everyone and ensure a pleasant dining experience. The only exception being the lovely Mathew who seemed to take on the entire work load by himself (while still finding time to make jokes with us and the tables beside us) while other members of staff stood chatting behind the bar! The food was bland to say the least and the bacon was so overcooked it was like eating glass. However compared to a few other hotels we have stayed at the choice of food wasn't bad. The hotel was very noisy in the evening both outside and in with constant footsteps passing by the door. Our trip to Amsterdam was lovely and it is a beautiful city. We will recommend that our friends look elsewhere for accommodation if visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close attractions and city centre....but ice cold bath rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LiloMilo
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect close to all attractions and city centre, all in walking distance.The hotel rooms were tiny, but then again we went for the budget small room. The bath room floors was so ice cold. When we called reseption, the house keeping came and told us to let the hot wather from the shower run to heat up the floor. Did not really help that mutch. And the bathroom was always cold. The sink was itsy bitsy tiny, you almost had spit ekstra long when you were brushing your teeth just to hit the sink. Because of the shelf placed over the tiny sink. Didn`t like the bathroom at all! But the rooms were clean and very helpfull staff! And ok beds, as i can remember... Would not go back. But didn`t hate it :) If you dont mind freezing your but off while taking a shower ore just taking a S... Sure i would recomend it. Really depends on what youre looking for. Good luck! :) PS Really bad internet conection.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid #106 !!”
Reviews.Author: Orca5
Reviews.Content: The primary duty of a 4 star hotel is to provide a restorative nights sleep. This the Hotel Vondel failed to do. Room #106 under the breakfast area so the LOUD scraping of the chairs on the tile floor overhead begins at the crack of dawn. It also goes on at night, as it is the bar area in the evening. The hotel was booked and we could not be moved to another room. It was extremely unpleasant, and the desk was totally indifferent. They did not charge for the bottled water to make up for the inconvenience. Too little, too late. Also, the couple in #105 across the hall from us had a very loud altercation. The Hotel Vondel was our worst experience in a month of touring Italy, France and Holland. This was the only hotel that charged 10 euros a day for wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: jafy73
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the only 2 bad points I could find with Hotel Vondel 1st Hotel room was a bit business like it needed a few homely touches. 2nd Our room was number 130 Executive room with jacuzzi and is situated by the main reception ,there is also a stair well located by your front door and bath room and you could hear people walking past your room and going up/down the stairs but not to the extent of waking you from your sleep . The Hotel is located in a very quite residential street a few minutes walk from the town,its very modern and clean and our room was great A tip for you hire a bike to get about we wish this is what we had done as it would of made things a touch easier 13 euros for the day. Now that is over the Hotel Vondel is a very nice hotel and I would definitely recommend you stay in this hotel if your thinking of visiting Amsterdam. It is situated 10-15 mins away from all the main attractions and it is a very pleasant walk to the main parts. When you 1st arrive at centrel station jump on trams 1,2,or 5 to Lieplinsen cost 2.60 euros you can get any of these trams back to centrel station from outside the Bull Dog. Like any city Amsterdam has its own problems with pickpockets and shady people just be vigilante act normal and enjoy yourself don't let other stories worry or put you off visiting Amsterdam as you do feel very safe there anyway. Lieplinsen town centre is a busy, bustling,lively up and coming place there's lots of restaurants ,pubs, theatres,cinemas and coffee shops to visit. Out of our 3 days we visited the red light district 4 times out of curiosity and is well worth a visit you can not go to Amsterdam and not visit the RLD . We will be going back to Amsterdam and Hotel Vondel will be the Hotel we will be staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Selinab_85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend recently. The hotel was clean and comfortable with ample room,on arrival we were given a free upgrade which was nice. The Decor was nice , The beds were really comfy & the bathroom was clean.. The shower was really good, we had a little small balcony with 2chairs on which was nice for the air on a sunny day - The staff seemed friendly enough when we spoke to them, The only bad thing if I were to nitpick would be the layout can be a bit confusing to find your room.. We had slight trouble finding the hotel as we were never in Amsterdam before - The website we booked it through didn't seem to offer us directions. Basically if you get the tram to Leidseplein look for the Marriot Hotel & it's on the road adjenct to that. The area seemed very well kept and not dodgy at all. We were really happy with our stay and would very much stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED - DO NOT STAY HERE FOR BUSINESS”
Reviews.Author: Businesstravel00
Reviews.Content: I am currently in-house at the Vondel and am experiencing the worst business event I have been involved with for several years. The meeting space is accurately photographed on their website, however does not mention the fact that the room is several floors underground, guests literally have to climb down tiny staircases as if entering a bunker. Downstairs in this grim dark room, the tables are in desperate need of repair/ replacement, you could injure yourself on the metal frames that are broken and splintered on several of the tables. It would have helped if they had tablecloths, though they do not and could not manage to arrange any with over half a day's notice. Throughout today if I had not asked for the coffee breaks to be served at least 5 times I doubt that they would have been served at all, still they were late. The lunch was a complete disaster, fish served raw, full of bones accompanied by rock hard risotto, it was only that the entree was such a large serving that the group are not going hungry, the main course and the desert (which was partly still frozen) were both un-edible. There were comments that this was the worst meal ever eaten...or rather not eaten, I am now actually starting to feel sick from the meal (the part of which I could eat). Trying to have documents printed here is also not advisable, the one printer they do have was unable to print 5 pages without jamming and the helpful staff that were on duty last night managed to completely break the printer with the rough manner in which they were trying to get it to work. The bedrooms are good, that is if you are lucky enough to be away from the ground floor where my colleague unfortunately was located and had to leave her tv on overnight in order to drown out the constant noise passing her door. The staff also like to argue, for example according to them my fish and the 20 un-eaten portions were apparently not raw..in this hotel it seems the customer is never right! So in short, a nice spot for a weekend getaway, anything more than that stay well clear!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: nats-dk
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right across all the bars, restaurents and the main shopping area. Van Gogh walking distance too. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No shower handles...the management removed them!”
Reviews.Author: mariosdarios
Reviews.Content: Trendy city centre hotel, but although our room had a shower and a bath tub no shower handle was available neither in the shower or the bath tub. We still wonder why the management took the decision to remove them... Anyway, breakfast area was very inviting and the overall room experience above avarage. Situated in a quiet steet near to many major Amsterdam attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Museum Quarter”
Reviews.Author: afrankon
Reviews.Content: Close to museums, clean accomodation, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellers_DC_London
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel. For Amsterdam the rooms are good size. The price was good. Short walk to the tram and entertainment area. Very nice boutique hotel. The one downside is that they charge for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Fine, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: BeandLou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, close to good restaurants and Vondel Park. Nice, modern and beautiful decoration. The room was a little disappointing for the price: too small and the bathroom was not so good. The shower door didn't close and the bathroom was totally wet after shower. My mini freezer was broken and the maintenance guy took too long to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice smart clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reethi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Vondel five years ago, and was slightly concerned by the poor reviews recently as it is on the expensive side. We were very happy that we had nothing to be concerned about. We had booked a small standard double and there was plenty of room, much bigger than a lot of bedrooms in Amsterdam. The room was on the third floor, as far from reception as you can get. Watch out which lift you get as you can't access all of the third floor from the first lift. The room was modern and smart, and cleaned perfectly everyday. The bathroom was the best bit, with a massive double shower and double his and hers sink. There were load of good tv channels and the bed was really comfy. Would definitely go back, if we could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BooBooKitty82
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and great little hotel. Basement rooms on road side can be noisy with guests arriving but we were garden side which was lovely. Close walking distance to everything and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Don't stay on basement floor!!”
Reviews.Author: Easton-G Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Vondel for a one year aniversary. The hotel was nice and clean, the staff were helpful and it's location was out on the edge of the city away from the hussle and bussle so if you don't mind a 10 minute walk into the center and want somewhere fairly quiet it's excellent (it suited us fine!) We would stay here again with no hesitation but would insist upon booking that we were not given a basement floor room, the basement rooms are directly below the restaurant, all you can hear all night and early in the morning is VERY loud chair moving/table moving and loud talking and people walking about, it made sleeping very difficult before midnight! The breakfast was excellent, with a good selection of croissants, rolls etc etc. they will also provide a cooked breakfast on request. We did see a mouse one evening running around in the bar area , it was cold outside and he probably wanted to stay somewhere warm, overall it's a nice hotel so why not in the hotel Vondel!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice and quiet hotel in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Marit68
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 4 nights at Vondel and we can recommend this hotel to everyone who like to stay in the centre and in walking distance of things do see and do. The only slight criticism would be the breakfast: 20 Eur - not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced for the quality of accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Mrschoo
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel through Trip Advisor and the good reviews, and booked online. We are used to city hotels being expensive but when we saw the size of the room! Compared to other city/boutique hotels we have stayed in, we were very disappointed. It was like a converted garage and we could just makie out a square of sky through the window if we craned our necks! If we had been larger there was no way we could have sat on the loo! The housekeeping was very poor - it was clean etc but we had to ask every day for more tea bags, sugar, tissues and there were never any tea spoons! Public areas were nice and we didn't eat there and chose to have breakfast in cafes. Would recommend for location but not at this price.

Reviews.Title: “First visit last year was OK, this one very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mikkelmann
Reviews.Content: The Vondel is in a very good location, but the price does not fit to the rooms especially clean! The rooms are SOOOOO small and noisy, very modern equiped but not good maninained. The shower door does not close correct so that the whole bath was under water - the bath had max 4m2. So if you want to stay in a small room - for big budget...stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not reccomended! Avoid !”
Reviews.Author: skrUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in the hotel. The main issues are the lack of cleanliness. The WC in the bathroom was stained with urine and blood. we asked for someone to clean it, and a man showed up and took the toilet brush, rubbed it around the toilet seat and then wiped it with a towel. Obviously this was a complete farse, and we complaint to the receptionist who accepted our complaint but did nothing to rectify the issue of cleanlisness. In addition, the mattress was terrible and old. For a four star hotel that is unacceptable to say the least. It is a shame that a 4* hotel in Holland should be so dirty. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: marioyahoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 201 which was a spacious room facing the street with balcony on which I was allowed to smoke my cigarette. The room was clean and the bed comfy. The lobby was trendy - I did not had breakfast or dinner at their restaurant although it looked cozy. The staff was really nice (thanks Carla for all your help) and I had a good stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but room a little tired now”
Reviews.Author: SunshineHoliday30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vondel having previously stayed in the sister hotel, the Roemer, which we had loved. The Vondel is not up to the standard of the newer Roemer, and is very expensive. The room was a little tired and some things had been broken, such as the controls on the spa bath. Our room was on the ground floor and was noisy when people walked past late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best upgrade ever!”
Reviews.Author: TinksUK1
Reviews.Content: After getting our room heavily discounted via booking.com we paid only 90 Euro for a double room. We arrived 3hrs before check-in and the hotel was pretty busy. Despite this the staff were very friendly, gave us an excellent map of the city and put our bags in storage. On returning to the hotel at 5pm the staff had resold our room as a family needed it and as grattitude upgraded us to the best room in the hotel, the executive suite! They even included a free breakfast, as if a massive room with it's own jaccuzi wasn't enough! The hotel is lovely, well decorated with a beautiful garden. A little expensive for drinks and food but then Amsterdam isn't exactly a cheap city anyway. Our room was huge with double shower and massive bathroom. A good selection of TV channels including a few English language ones was a nice touch while the missus took an enternity to get ready. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The only downside is the long walk (1 mile) to Old Amsterdam at night as the trams finish before midnight. Highly reccommended. I'll certainly be going back next time, just hope they have to upgrade me again!

Reviews.Title: “Terribly unfriendly and unsmiling staff”
Reviews.Author: wishiweredownunder
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Vondel left us with a very bad impression of the people of Amsterdam. The staff were unfriendly, unsmiling and behaved as though even checking us in was an inconvenience to them. We were put in a TINY room a long walk from the front desk. Cute boutique hotel in a good location but with very unfriendly staff that taint the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small, expensive and fancy.”
Reviews.Author: alohomora713
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend. We chose it from Booking.com based on the photos and some of the reviews. We were looking for something slightly high-end. This was our first trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is outside the central rings of the city, but not overly far away from the centre. I tend to like to be slap bang in the middle of everything, so perhaps that's why I was dissatisfied with the walk to the hotel. It's on a charming street, and is contained in several houses. The lobby is quaint but high class. Black marble and furnishings give a very luxurious feel. The front desk staff were polite and checked us in adaquately. The room we booked was a twin. It was on the top floor. Unfortunately because of this, the room was full of ceiling beams and girders so the space was very limited. Putting on one's tshirt was difficult at times. Because of how small the room was, there was no divide between the twin beds, which is always annoying for people who regularly choose such a bed configuration, namely anyone who's not going away with a partner. Consequentially the bathroom was on the small side, with the ceiling beams proving troublesome here also. Also, when coming home late at night (as one is prone to do when staying in the Dam) the front door is locked, so you have to ring the bell and wait to be let in like you've forgotten your keys and have to wake up your Mammy. Overall I wouldn't stay here, or recommend this hotel based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Beautiful Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LilithC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vondel for three nights and absolutely loved it! The staff are very helpful, professional and friendly. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated. There is also tons of great artwork displayed throughout. The location is perfect: close enough to just about everything but far enough away to get a good nights rest. The only negatives that I can think of are that wifi isn't free (10 Euro for 24 hours). Also, their restaurant needs a bit of work. We ordered the goat cheese salad which actually came out with brie on it instead and the roasted vegetable entree was gratin potatoes with green and yellow peppers in it which were not the vegetables listed on the menu. Food was good but not worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy boutique hotel (if you like that sort of thing), but everything's extra!”
Reviews.Author: Redtitian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in July during hot weather (so the a/c was appreciated). The hotel was in a good location, with many things easily walkable. It was converted from several very old houses, so narrow, steep stairs (but lifts also available). Our room was small but adequate (although the fan in the tiny bathroom wasn't working and wasn't fixed whilst we were there, despite asking). Pleasant small terrace garden available. Main gripe (besides the awful "artwork" which looked like it had been done by an inebriated young child), was that everything was extra (even though the room itself wasn't exactly cheap): breakfast (cir. â‚¬19 pp per day, but good, provided you don't come down too close to the end, when things were running out); movies in the room (which at around â‚¬10 each made it a lot cheaper to go and buy a DVD); and in particular, internet in the rooms (also expensive and which surely these days, should be provided automatically - like hot water?!). Staff were great, friendly and very helpful, the bed was extremely comfortable, the room (at the rear of the property) was quiet and it was good to come back to the hotel at the end of a long, hot day!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location within easy reach of centre and museums”
Reviews.Author: beagle072
Reviews.Content: Cosy rooms, bit on small size but comfy beds and quiet. Very helpful staff at the bar with lovely but on the expensive side breakfasts. Would stay here again but possibly ask for larger room. No restaurants close by, one on the corner was closed all weekend but not too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “v convenient location for city break transport links exellent but away from hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: val095
Reviews.Content: improvements to soundproofing of rooms from corridor would enhance sleep quality

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel central to everything”
Reviews.Author: GrapeOccasions
Reviews.Content: Having returned to Amsterdam a month after moving away this was a great hotel to still feel the charm of the city in the center without staying in one of the chains. I had a great room on the very bottom floor that overlooked the back park area (one downside was the staff smoked out there but didn't happen often). Fantastic bathroom! Hotel restaurant and bar are great! And when its nice weather, which thankfully the week was, you can enjoy the back patio garden for a drink and/or dinner! Definitely would stay here again whether business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly sufficient”
Reviews.Author: heathmc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vondel was a perfect spot for our two-day mini vacation, right around the corner from Leidseplein, which is a very lively area in Amsterdam. Hard Rock, along with the Holland casino are nearby, also walking distance to the Van Gogh museum and tons of shopping. It was actually a very nice hotel. The rooms received a lower rating because of the slightly suffocating small size. Although we were fine and expected it, just be prepared. Sleep quality also received a lower rating because of the housekeepers. Early in the am after a long day and night in Amsterdam, I'm talking 8a, the last thing we want is to hear the constant banging of doors. The beds were the best in Europe so far. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Little Dutch Charm”
Reviews.Author: KlaudiaC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, great location, and full of character. I prefer boutique hotels so i can feel which country i am in then the big global chains. This fit the bill perfectly .The staff were lovely and helpfull . The only short comings were a few things missing from the room, like coffee but this was quickly fixed. We walked to most places but the tram is by the door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: starcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend and had a lovely trip in Amsterdam. Location of the hotel is very good, near to Leidseplein and Museum District. We had an nice executive room which was spacious and had a seperate walk in shower. Room was clean and service was great. Also enjoyed the nice breakfast buffet, try the fresh made pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for lovers”
Reviews.Author: ghost_object
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights at Christmas. We reserved through their website about 2 months in advance and got a medium room for 2 for about 70e per night. It was a cosy hotel with corridors like a labyrinth. Don't know if it's so design, but for sure, it's not old and very comfortable. Just the sink in the bathroom wasn't very easy to use. We asked for a room with a bath and not in the basement and got it.
