And also we got a ticket for free drinks at their nice bar because we booked through their own website:) Medium room was small but had all comfort. I would stay here again, because I know it's nice and it's in Leidseplein, which has all and a bit less tourists than around the railway station. Their breakfast seemed expensive (20e and wasn't included) so we didn't try it.... so many choices in the streets all around! But their restaurant smelled very good and their wine was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dwerner151
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night, this was a great hotel located in the heart of one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The room was clean and comfortable, lunch at the hotel was excellent, employees were very helpful, and overall it deserves a very high rating. Without question, we would stay there again if we get back to Amsterdam. Dave & Sue Werner, Malone, NY USA

Reviews.Title: “Too bad its so noisy!”
Reviews.Author: JeffSeattleLondon
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel and nice staff. Wasn't thrilled with the basement level bedroom but was moved after one night. My big complaint is the noise from the cleaning staff. If they could just navigate around the hotel quietly our stay would've been a lot better. We wont stay again but if your a person that is up early then the noise may not bother you in which case this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's Just Like Amsterdam - Fun and Slightly Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: ThePrince49
Reviews.Content: A few neighboring houses were tied together to make this interesting hotel. It was a nice use of existing buildings and it fits into the neighborhood beautifully. The downside is that getting to your room may involve a choice between small elevators or steep steps. I have stayed in Amsterdam before and if I am going to be in the most interesting parts of the city I don't expect a highrise with long halls. This is such a great part of the city I think it is well worth whatever trouble it takes to enjoy the quirks of a hotel that fits you into some of Amsterdam's typical architecture. Our room was small and perfectly clean. The breakfast was great. The location near the Leidesplein and the Museums is the best location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly staff, nice rooms, comfortable quiet surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: HuddersfieldNick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good quiet location and most attractions are easily accessed. Its clean, trendy and the staff on my visit were very pleasant and courteous. They offered a room upgrade as the better room had not been sold which is always one of the easiest and most sensible ways to gain a customers satisfaction. I was very pleased with my choice on this occasion and would not hesitate to return. Didn't experience breakfast or the restaurant as we had other business meetings pre arranged. Overall I could not really fault it . Already thinking of treating my wife and maybe returning later in the year or certainly next spring.

Reviews.Title: “It literally STINKS”
Reviews.Author: aliasJupiter
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the 4th floor, and one room on the next building. You could not even walk around the bed they were SO small. The lamps did not work, there was no space in the breakfast room even though we "reserved"... but the worst was the unbearable sewer smell in the bathrooms, it was a nightmare to wash your teeth in there! The funny thing is, they ignored our requests totally while we were there, but as soon as we got home they sent us an email asking that if we were happy with our stay, to write a review here, but if we were NOT, please contact them directly.........ironic! If you are looking for location and good prices, there's 5 other hotels in the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Roisinmt
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a business meeting for twenty colleagues. While searching for a venue Hotel Vondel came up the clear winner within our price bracket. Right from the start the staff were incredibly helfpul in creating a contract for the meeting that addressed all of my teams' needs. This helpful attitude carried throughout our entire stay. I felt very confident knowing that if something should go wrong or if I needed help with anything that the staff would help me sort out the issue and would do it graciously. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam - on either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chewpen
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the basement. It was a good size and clean but the only window was onto the pavement so that all you could see was people's ankle's walking by (and don't be fooled, from the pavement passers-by can see much more of you!). I asked whether it would be possible to move rooms. I was shown to another room but there was a very strange smell in it and it was just as gloomy because it was still in the basement but at the back of the hotel, therefore declined it. I was advised that there would be no problem moving us to another room the following day and we should just leave our bags out and they would sort it out. The next morning we were relieved to be moving as the noise from the road, throughout the night, and also from the chairs and tables scraping above at breakfast meant that we got little sleep. However, we were moved to a tiny room, their small double (which is not what we had paid for) and the walls were paper thin. You could literally hear every single word the person next door was saying and their bags being unzipped! This was really disappointing, and minor things that I would not have notice otherwise became noticeable i.e broken hairdryer, shampoo had been watered down and an empty shower cap box. Oh, and check your bill carefully! Some additional items were added to our bill which they were quick to remove. On a positive note, the bar and breakfast were great. However, we would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: BruxelleStephanie78
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is definately one of our favorite places in the world, and we like to come here often. Friends that came over in december recomended this hotel, so we booked for 4 nights. We were very surprised by the earlier comments made in another review, because we had an AMAZING time in hotel Vondel! Yes the rooms might be a little bit smaller, but what do you want? It's Amsterdam! We were definately impressed by the friendly staff, and the hotel has an great atmosphere! The English server at night really went out of his way to find more great places for us to visit since that was the 8th time in Amsterdam. He made us a list with great idea's. Since we're comming back in summer we already booked for another 4 nights, and we are looking forward to return to this hotel. Stephanie, Antoin, Anton, and Sebastien ( Bruxelle )

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel Vondel”
Reviews.Author: TessainParis
Reviews.Content: Overwhelming sewer stench in prison cell size room. Indifferent staff. Is there a manager? In hiding? All requests for help ignored. Predatory pricing of these substandard rooms. Pickpockets at entrance can easily take the lift to upper floors and attack anyone in the dark winding corridors. For health and safety, try one of the many clean comfortable hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “What no A/C?”
Reviews.Author: LadybootsLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a really nice vibe. Staff were friendly and helpful, location great and the decor pleasant. However, our room was miniscule and could have substituted for the hotels sauna. There was no A/C, which in a modern hotel charging those prices is unforgivable. For that reason alone, we would not recommend this hotel in the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Adventurers_Three
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great location to see the museums and enjoy Vondal Park a must. We traveled with our 6 month old and were treated very well. We booked on the Hotel web page which I would highly recommed, "small double room" with a child cot. On our arrival we were informed that the small double room is not large enough to have a cot added, they provided an executive room on the third floor at a small additonal fee. The room was very large for Amsterdam and a lovely on-suite. Ok the bed is two twins side by side, but this is Europe and how else would they get a Queen bed into the room? The staircase are step but we used the elevator. As for paper thin walls not sure we did not have any complaints about our little guy waking up the neighbours. We pass on breakfast so not able provide comment on that. This is a fabulous hotel close to the museums but on a quite street with all the tram service you could desire nearby, and an Albert Heines (grocery store) at the closest major block intersection. Should you be traveling with family or just two and you want something nice this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no cigar.....”
Reviews.Author: WaterfordMagnum
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Amsterdam for a surprise birthday trip & we stayed at the Vondel for 2 nights. It certainly looked the part, stylish & secluded, down a rather pleasant side-street. It's also certainly well placed in Leidseplein, 10 minutes by tram from central station & near to museums & numerous bars & restaurants. The basement room we stayed in was an Executive room & was well equipped, with an excellent en-suite. The bed was disappointing however, (2 singles pushed together with a thin double mattress on top, a bit odd really) Our first night passed unremarkably. We didn't partake of the â‚¬20 a head breakfast, yep, that's â‚¬20 a head! instead opting for an early lunch out. After a smashing day out & about in Amsterdam & following a lovely Indonesian meal & a few beers, we headed back to the hotel & off to bed at around 1.00 a.m. At 4.00 a.m we were awoken by the guests next door, (I can confirm the walls are exceptionally thin.) Having bluntly told said guests to quieten down, (it was 4.00. a.m remember) I phoned the reception to have a word. The night manager had the cheek to tell me I was being a little "sharp," so I reminded him that it was 4 in the morning & that we'd be paying good money for our stay & that I was entitled to get some sleep. Later that morning whilst I was enjoying a shower, my partner went to see the general manager who was kind of apologetic in a typically well-groomed businesslike manner. He offered us breakfast, yep the â‚¬20 ones for FREE, as recompense. Unfortunately, my partner, when bringing this news, fell down the ridiculously tight stairwell & hurt her back, elbow & thigh (which now has a bruise the size of a grapefriut) This hotel has pretentions as a chic, boutique sort of affair & it's pleasant enough, including most of the staff. However it doesn't quite make it & to be honest neither does the breakfast. â‚¬20 for some scrambled egg & bacon & average coffee... Get me one of those Grand Marnier infused pancakes from the stand round the corner any day!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Amsterdam close to the city center”
Reviews.Author: JoachimQ
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice and very calm hotel. The whole style is very modern and the rooms are quite trendy. The restaurant is good even if you come with groups of 15 people, same counts for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quirky rooms, good stay.”
Reviews.Author: KCEdin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with my husband in mid-November 09. We booked the hotel as part of a package through Lastminute and it was reasonably priced compared to other options. The public areas and bar/restaurant are nice, quirky and modern, and we did see the cat reported by a previous reviewer! The cleanliness of the hotel was great, it is well cared for and the staff were very helpful. The receptionist helped us to book a table for dinner in a restaurant in town on Saturday night, which was great, and were very helpful with the room we wanted. When we booked we had asked for an "L" room on a high floor because of the previous reviews about street noise in the lower ground floor rooms. I had asked for a bath as well but it turns out the lower ground rooms have baths because they're bigger than the upper floor "L" rooms which have a shower instead. Shame, as I really love a bath. We could have upgraded to a better room which do have baths, but they didn't have any the first night and the room they gave us on the top floor was nice enough that I wasn't bothered about moving after that. We did see a lower ground floor room and I would advise asking for a higher floor as the windows in these rooms are at street level and I thought it would be pretty impossible to open the windows without it being noisy - even though the street is very quiet traffic-wise. The room we stayed in was very nice - in the eaves with beams showing and a nice wet room type bathroom. It wasn't exactly enormous but to be honest even though we spent quite a lot of time in it, it was perfectly fine. If you can afford it and you're going to spend a lot of time in the room, I would get one of the rooms with a sofa etc, as that would have been handy. The bed was comfy and large enough for my husband who is over 6ft. No complaints there! Really good transport links to the hotel - about 5 minutes walk to the Leidseplein where you can get one of three trams to the Central station, taking about 10 minutes. Plenty of restaurants etc in the nearby area, and great shopping within walking distance! One thing I would do is avoid the restaurant - it's expensive for what you get and the meal I had there on Sunday was pretty average. The creme brulee was nice, but apart from that I would recommend sticking to the drinks! There are much better and cheaper places for dinner close by. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that. Overall, we liked the hotel and thought it was a great location and perfect for getting around the centre, if dissappointed by the standard of the restaurant. I only ate there because my husband was ill and didn't want to go out, so if you're looking for somewhere to stay as a base for exploring the town and eating out, I would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vondel”
Reviews.Author: JussiM3
Reviews.Content: quiet place, yet near the Leidsesquare and tram routes. Crew from Miami Ink stayed there too!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: fronemophobiac
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. clean, well kept, and modern. within walking distance to many major attractions. would easily recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: callmepicky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and situated on a nice quiet pretty road, which I was pleased with. However, when we checked in the staff gave us the smallest room you have ever seen and what is more someone else was already checked in there and that was after a wasted journey to the wrong side of the hotel as directed by the receptionist. It all ended well as we were given a lot larger room and an apology. However, I think if it was not for this error by the staff we would have just accepted the room given, which was not 4*, more 3*. The breakfast was very good and the hotel friendly enough, however for such a small hotel some of the staff were a little clueless!!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room for the price, overpriced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SU2
Reviews.Content: The Vondel hotel is conveniently located in walking distance from all places in Amsterdam centre. It is in the old building, but it was recently renovated. Some furniture is ultra modern, like unusual shapes of water sink and shower. However, the value for money is low. I paid approx. 110 Euro per night during my 3 days stay. The room was extremely small. The were two bunk bends (one above the other), a table slightly larger than A4 paper already full of hotel stuff. The space between the beds and the table and clothing cabinet was just enough to pass through. Breakfast cost 19.95 Euro, which I rejected. I expect a decent dinner for this price, rather than breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnh1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Hotel Vondel and we really liked the hotel. We could check in at noon without any problems and because we only stayed for 2 days in Amsterdam this was really convenient. The room was nice and the bathroom was spacious. We did not use the breakfast although we had a drink in the garden before we went for dinner. We also choose to go out for dinner despite the hotel restaurant offered a 3 course meal for only E 25.00. The location of the hotel is great. The staff was very friendly and helpfull in finding a restaurant for us. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Oooo Wee....It smells like rotten cheese!”
Reviews.Author: MarsMan14
Reviews.Content: We had to wait a little bit because we were a bit early and our room wasn't ready. The front desk lady was nice and let us leave our baggage with all the millions of other baggage in the lobby (apparently, everyone had come early). While in the lobby, we met someone who claimed that he was with B-Real. Since I couldn't tell you who B-Real is from P Diddy, I can't confirm this claim. The lobby was comfortable yet modern. The staff, super friendly. When we walked into our room, we couldn't help but cover our nose and yell, "Ooo weee...it smells like rotten cheese!" Since our room was on the lower level, I think all the rain had seeped into cracks and caused some sort of mildew to form, since it definitely smelled moldy in there. We complained to the front desk people and all they did was leave the windows open when we left for the day. The overall appearance of our room was nice. A comfortable queen size bed in the middle, a flat screen tv, plenty of windows, and a nice mini fridge. The bathroom had a modern twist. Nice concrete sinks. However, we did have a drainage problem. Both the sink and the shower would not drain! My poor boyfriend had to go in there and stick his hand into the dirty drain filled with other people's hair. So gross!!! The location of the hotel was nice. It's walking distance to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gough Museum, and Vondelpark. Overall, the staff was friendly and the hotel itself was beautiful. I would stay here again, but maybe in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: MrVonnegut
Reviews.Content: I've been fortunate to travel quite a bit and have stayed in a wide variety of places over the years. From youth hostels in France to numerous 5 star hotels in China so I'm well aware that you get what you pay for. However, you should at least get what you pay for! I bought a 4 day stay here through Expedia and the hotel is listed as a 4 star hotel. When I'm paying myself, a 4* is more than enough comfort and service I need at a price that I can afford. How this hotel ever got a 4* rating is beyond me an the hotel and service was comparable with a Travel Lodge - but at least the Travel Lodge has fiendly staff and costs a lot less! When we first arrived our rooms weren't ready so we left our bags and went for a walk to the Leidseplein. We weren't early but they had cleaning staff off sick so we gave them the benefit of the doubt and had lunch. On our arrival back there was a huge queue at the desk with only one woman checking everyone in. Unfortunately she was dealing with a problem with one of the guests rooms and we had to wait 20 minutes to finaly check in. The complaning guest was not happy with their room being under the bar and the noise that came with people wanding around on the wooden floor. They were moved to another room and we were checked in. The room was an ok size and apart from looking a bit shabby very comfortable - until night time. Then as the bar upstairs filled up we realised we were in the room under the bar! Being late we did nothing about it until the morning (we had unpacked already and showered) In the morning I went to reception and it was as if the firl already knew what I wanted to say and was already making preperation for a room change. I also pointed out to her that I had paid extra for a deluxe room and she apologised saying that this had not been noticed at check in and we were shown an enormous room on the first floor of the main building. We moved in to this room and were given free breakfast tokens as way of an apology. (Breakfast is in another building about 5 doors down the road) At breakfast a rogue mouse was running around and causing a great deal of fuss and the staff acted as though this was a normal occurance and barely batted an eyelid. All those at that breakfast were given another free voucher for the next day which I threw in the bin immediately. That night, I could hear a strange scatching noise coming from our bed. I switched the one working lamp on (they never did fix the other lamp even after I asked several times) To our horror there was a mouse on the bed and another climbing up the crtains (which we 2-3 metres high!) I Immediately went downstairs to speak to reception who said they had been having trouble with mice and offered me - you giuessed it - a free breakfast! I told them what they could do with their mouse infested breakfast and asked for a kettle to be brought to my room so I could have a cup of tea and calm down. Unfortunately, they said, the kettle is already in another guests room and they cant wake them up to get it for me. Have you ever heard of a 4 star hotel with one shared kettle for ALL its guest?!?! A mix of this along with what I now understand to be matrimonial beds (2 single begds screwed together - not a real double bed as UK readers will know) we decided to check out and move to the 5* Marriot about 300 metres down the road. I will never get the lost money back from Expedia and wish I had found this site before I left. Given the huge amount of negative reviews for this hotel I could have been forewarned and stayed elsewhere. I'm not overly sensitive, but I was on holiday and payed a decent amount to stay here. If you want a nice relaxing holiday and dont want any hassle do not stay at the Vondelstraat as you dont need stress when you're trying to unwind!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on quiet location in the middle of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: jeroens
Reviews.Content: I planned a Romantic weekend in Amsterdam for me and my grifriend and choose this hotel because we liked the boutique style and it was on walking distance from the city center. I did not make an advance booking but had checked the website and noticed they had still some free rooms left and I wanted to see the place first before staying there. Uppon arrival I asked for a double room for 1 night which they had available. The receptionist also mentioned to take a look at the neighbouring partner Hotel Roemer. She told us it has even nicer rooms and all rooms where executive style there. On both Hotels we asked if we could see the rooms which was no problem. The standard room in hotel Vondel had no airco but a fan instead and looked a bit small though it was clean and newly decorated. 10 years ago I would not even think of looking at things like an air-conditioning in a hotel in Holland but especially in these old buildings it can be quit hot in the summer so I almost believe Climate Controll is a must have now! The receptionist then showed us the so called executive room (131) on the ground floor which looked very nice! The room was big enough, located on the street side but this was no problem for us because it is a very quiet location. Nicely basic decorated (see photo's), flatscreen TV, new bathroom with jacuzzi and seperate shower and a good working airco. The Executive Room in Roemer also looked very nice and had a jacuzzi, airco, flatscreen TV and a I-POD dock. Because we could get a better price in hotel Vondel for the executive room we decided to take that room instead of the room in the Roemer Hotel. When we wanted to use the jacuzzi in the evening I discovered it was broken and after the technician took a look he said he could not fix it for us this night. Because we only stayed 1 night I went to the reception to check if we could arrange something. The friendly girl immediately gave us a new room which actually was a free upgrade to a suite upstairs (535) (see photos) The suite was great. A very big room with a bigger jacuzzi attached to the bed, a big flatcreen TV on the wall, A seperate very spacious and nice looking shower with 2 seperate Rainshowers and an ceiling airco which was strong enough to cool down the loft style room easily! Like all hotels if breakfast is not included it's a bit expensive (19 euro p.p.) No problem because in the area there are enough places you can eat. Internet (WIFI/LAN cable) is available in the room but was not included in the room price. The price was 10 euro for all day which is not that expensive but still. If I stay longer in a hotel these are things I (and probably many other people) look for and prefer to have included in the room price. But there is 1 laptop in the restaurant though which can be used for free. There was a nice looking garden to have some drinks and snacks or just to relax. We did not have time to spend some time there but it all looked very nice. We really liked the hotel, the style of the rooms, the boutique style decoration downstairs of the bar/lobby/restaurant, and the walking distance to the city centre. Although some of the employees where trainees I believe everybody was very helpfull and friendly to us. Some only speak english but I personally think that is fine in an international city like Amsterdam. Although I always like to check out new places this is really a nice hotel which I definetly would return to for a romantic stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but no charm”
Reviews.Author: raginmac
Reviews.Content: This place came recommended by another website that we usually rely upon (after confirmation from tripadvisor!). Positives: lobby is pretty cool, great location. We averaged 150 euros per night over 6 nights. Not a massive amount, but enough to expect certain things... Thing 1: The hotel asks for arrival time on their booking page. Okay, we provided it (early one morning). The usual check in time is 3pm. We had expected that we would have to set our bags down and go out for the day. The very rude front desk receptionist (who told us to wait while she finished a conversation in dutch with her friend) told us that the room wasn't ready and wouldn't be so until later that day, but if we would pay 20 euros extra she could guarantee a 2pm check in. 1 hour, 20 euros. hmmmm... This would be interesting, 6 nights to go and already they're hitting us for optional extras. Thing 2: 15 euros extra for plug in internet access... Other hotels usually include this for free and wireless Thing 3: Room... Not the biggest, but not unexpected. Bathroom well appointed, if you exclude towels (only 1), toilet products (no soap or shampoo) and bathmat. Thing 5: Service... TV broke on the 4th night (a friday). We rang front desk and told them. They sent their maintenance man up who couldn't fix it. Eventually, I got it working. Same thing happened later that night. Rang front desk again who said she couldn't do anything about it that evening (maintenance man gone home) but would get someone onto it the next morning. I told them that it had to be fixed the next night as we were having an early night and would be watching some tv. otherwise they would have to change the room. Ok she said. Saturday night: TV not fixed and suddenly no idea about problem. SAME GIRL! early flight on the monday, so told her again to fix the problem or we would be demanding a room change or our money back for the last two nights. Yes sir, will be fixed sir. No better sunday night. She (same girl) told us that she would have management call us the next day to arrange some compensation. No call, no calls returned and no further correspondence. I guess the thing that annoyed us the most is that this is a four star hotel that is supposed to have a certain level of service. The TV isn't an issue as our time in Amsterdam was great otherwise. We found other things to do (I read a book... it hurt) but to not follow up on a service request from a customer who had paid upfront (pre booked a cheap rate) is a little poor. We expected more and were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: GuinessGalore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just that, adequate. Arrived at check in on a friday evening and was given the key to a very small single room, turned out it was someone else's room (thank goodness they were not in). Finally arrived in our room and it was very clean and functional but there were two single beds...very disappointing if you are a couple. The bathroom was very clean although small. There was only one laptop in the reception area with no printer so you have to email your board pass to hotel reception. There was a hot breakfast and it is good to set you up for the day. By city standards and location you cannot get any better, but for the price you pay it is not work it.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Kalisi
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, spacious and clean. Staff were very polite. Great position and area. Close to all shops and attractions. Food and drinks inside the hotel were very expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Could be lovely but severely let down”
Reviews.Author: Julofromtheblock
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Vondel for a couple of nights this May, and on first impression it's quite a cool, kooky place and good value for money. But the service leaves a bit to be desired, it's mostly not with a smile, and the double room was such a let down. If you stay here make sure you're not in Room 101 which is next to the lift and stairs and in the hotel's basement. The noise - from the traffic outside on the street, on the pavement, from the automatic front doors, the lift...you name it, we could hear it. Amplified. Such a shame, as it could be so nice, however it really lives up to it's misnomer. We asked to change rooms and were offered a twin room, when doubles were mysteriously still available on their website - we're talking a Monday night here. Business travellers beware, you're probably better off paying for internet access through your phone than being charged over 15 euros for 24 hours worth of internet access. Come on Hotel Vondel, pull your socks up and put conditioner in the bathrooms, too.

Reviews.Title: “Amizing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerenle
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time there. beautiful room great shower. the location is perfect!!! dont miss out!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms but unpolished!”
Reviews.Author: EUEx-pat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Vondel for 3 nights in February 2009. We (my boyfriend and I) were there for Valentineâ€™s Day weekend to visit some friends. Transportation We drove to Amsterdam for the weekend. We parked our automobile in the Byzantium parking garage that is close by the hotel (2 minute walk). The garage is expensive (4 euros per hour) however, it is very secure allowing those that only have a parking ticket to enter the garage area. We walked around the city for the rest of our stay. Neighborhood The hotel is located on Vondelstraat just south of Leidesplein. It is a very good location as it is close to Museumplein and within walking distance to the centrum to the other attractions. Vondelstraat is a quiet street which made it ideal so that you donâ€™t have any noise from the busy city. Tram #1 is close by if you need to go farther places in the city. The area around the hotel is safe and is close to the higher end shopping streets (Van Baerlestraat and Pieter Cornelisz (P.C.) Hooftstraat). Although the hotel is just outside the center it is within walking distance and provides a peaceful stay. Room (photos included) We had a Two Person Room (Tweepersoons Kamer â€“ room 435) and our rate was â‚¬150 as an average per night for the weekend (not including breakfast). We booked the hotel through the hotel website. The room was a good size and had a neutral modern dÃ©cor (room was carpeted). The bed is actually two twin beds together and very comfortable. The room had a sofa but could serve as a third bed. It also had two chairs and a wardrobe that had a safe and mini bar fridge inside. Bathroom (photos included) The bathroom was very spacious. The dÃ©cor was in a dark stone color. Our bathroom had a shower/tub combination with a rain showerhead. The toiletries were the Rituals brand â€“ smelled very nice â€“ shampoo, shower gel and bar soap. The bathroom included a hair dryer as well. The bathroom was very clean. Amenities/Service We did have drinks in the bar area one night. The bar area is decorated nicely and we found the bar food not so good â€“ the offerings were mainly fried food. The hotel staff was very nice and courteous. There is also one laptop located in the bar/lounge area if you want to use the internet and check email. However in the room we could connect to the internet as a plug in for the internet was provided â€“ this we could use for no charge. Overall the hotel was suitable and for its location the price was reasonable. There are a few things that were unpolished about the hotel â€“ tile grout was damaged around many tiles on the floor in the common area, bartender insulted the guests at the bar (maybe the bartender was trying to be funny but it was annoying as she spoke very loudly to the other guests in the bar while we were trying to enjoy our drinks), the bathroom faucets were really low so that you have barely enough room for your hands to fit and the manager of the hotel yelled at one of the maids in front of us in the elevator (he heard us speaking English in the elevator and spoke nastily to the maid in Dutch not releasing that we spoke Dutch as well). The overall stay was pleasant and these little things for a four star hotel are the reason why the rating is a bit lower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but 4 stars??”
Reviews.Author: mitzy_m00
Reviews.Content: We had booked a large double room which was a great size but lacking the cosy feel I like in a hotel. It just didn't have the 4 star quality I'd looked forward to. No Mirror in room so had to make do with the one in the bathroom where the light wasn't very good. The bedroom lights in general were very dull although we did have great big windows. Room service kept forgetting to replace coffee/milk in our room and the movie channels didn't work! On the plus size, the room was very clean and spacious and the staff were lovely and very helpful. Some of the art work on the walls were gorgeous. Walking distance to a fantastic range of bars/shops/restaurants. Vondel park is also a 2 minute walk away and Anne Fr ank House 15 minutes. The street is so peaceful and you really feel like you're miles away from the busy town centre. Would probably not stay there again as I feel it wasn't good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I remember staying in Vondel Hotel - Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Zamorano
Reviews.Content: I stayed in "L" room but it wasn't really LARGE. I wonder how small are the "S" rooms. Decoration was nice, with a good bathroom. Location very good (quiet but not so far). The staff was OK and so was the view was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy; no complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: Feb44
Reviews.Content: I saw all the reviews complaing about small rooms so was expecting the worse, however as we had booked a triple room we were pleasantly suprised. The room was spacious with large windows, 3 proper beds, not a third roll-away as offered by the Radisson (at over twice the cost!). The hotel is in a lovely quiet street, but so close to the city. It was so easy to find, and a breeze to get to from the airport via train and tram. The staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. (We had no problem getting back in in the early hours, something which had worried me!) We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because there are so many fabulous cafe's nearby serving the best coffee ever. The room was clean, the bathroom well equiped and the shower worked a treat. We didn't have time to switch the television on, so can't comment on that: there is just so much to do in Amsterdam, a weekend just isn't enough! We had a very comfortable stay at the Vondel, and would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok -but we must have had the worst room there”
Reviews.Author: GeriB
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the location near the Museum district and Leidesplein for nightlife. Also because it looked quirky and small enough not to be too impersonal. The location was ideal, especially if you intend to use trams/buses to get about and also because the street was quiet at night. I was a bit disappointed though because we must have had the worst room there.It was tiny. Ok that's not too much of an issue but it was in the basement with no windows apart from two skylights that looked out at pavement level. Also we were directly below the dining room which had wooden floors so that in the early morning you could hear every footfall above. Also the hotel does seem to try too hard to be "trendy". Decor is "Ikea" style but a little shabby and battered around the edges. Having said all that, the room was wonderfully clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. As it was winter, and absolutely freezing outside, the lack of windows and outlook was not too much of a problem but I would have asked to change rooms if it had been spring/summer. Breakfast was adequate and the staff were very friendly. Beware - the bar is extortionately expensive. A beer and a glass of wine was Â£13 - now that the pound and euro have parity the whole break was crazily expensive. If we went to Amsterdam again I would try to stay in one of the rated Bed and Breakfast accommodations rather than a hotel for a more relaxed experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sydney101
Reviews.Content: While we were waiting to check in 3 seperate guests/parties were complaining about their rooms and asking to be moved. Not a good start. Also there was a number of small kids running about the foyer and bar, so it was mayhem and noisy when we walked in. When it was our turn to check I asked the person who was checking us in if there was a sewing kit in the room as I had torn my dress getting out of the taxis...she rolled her eyes annoyed at me and said she'd send it up to the room, it never arrived. She was an intern and when I went down later to try get a sewing kit a very nice staff member gave me one. I felt claustrophic throughout my stay, the rooms are tiny which I knew about but the corriders are like warrens and hopefully there will never be a fire as you'd have no hope of getting out. Wild horse couldn't drag me back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vondel”
Reviews.Author: grovegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vondel from 24/10 to 27/10. Booked a medium double room through the internet, which when we arrived was very small (would not like to see the small double room). No mirror in the bedroom, has to use a mirror inside the wardrobe door, which while it was a good size,was difficult when trying dry your hair, as one had to stretch the hairdryer flex around the door(not exaclty safe). Over all the room was a little cramped, particularly as you entered the room, the bathroom door was to the right as you entered the room, so when you opened the door into the hotel room it blocked the bathroom door. However, the rest of the hotel was good, with a nice bar area and nice lounge area, with resident cat! The staff were friendly and competent (which was the case everywhere we went in the city). Good location in a nice quiet residential area, but still witihn walking distance to Dam Square and all attractions (Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Anne Frank House, shopping). Really pity about the room sizes. Would stay again if was sure of getting a better room.

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no”
Reviews.Author: GoldfishWoman
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take the boyfriend to my country of origin. Pits of a hotel, bedroom was a cupboard, bathroom stunk and was so 1970s. Appalling and it cost me more for the weekend with flights than 5 days in Rome in a proper 5 star hotel. Do not bother as you will be really, really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Vondel did well”
Reviews.Author: lucielexo
Reviews.Content: I arrived early Sunday morning 8 am after a long flight - the receptionist informed me that 1 room was clean, it was a basement room. I prefered to have a room so I agreed with this deal. The room was facing the garden. I got some sleep and did like the view but not the basement. I went to reception in the afternoon and I was told that I could move to another room without any problems! My luggage was moved by the hotel staff and when I came back it was a little suprise when I entered the room: I think I was upgraded to a bigger room, ground floor, facing garden again and with a jacuzzi! I stayed only for 2 nights, but wish I could have stayed longer. As a female traveller I felt very comfertable in this room. The receptionist where friendly and the hotel was nice decorated. There is a lot of art and the atmosphere is nice all over the place. I did not use the bar and breakfast. Next time I will ask for the same room and I look forward staying in this hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I wish they had bigger blankets”
Reviews.Author: SeanC67
Reviews.Content: Ideally located next to the Liedseplein tram stop, only two kilometers from Centraal Station, right next to the Vondelpark, and a brisk walk to the Rijkmuseum. Tried two rooms whilst there, the first did not have a double bed as requested, merely two singles pushed together. Both rooms were otherwise well furnished with nice bathrooms, and a mixture of traditional and modern dutch styles. However, even in the 2nd room which did have a double bed, it had 2 single bed duvets on it which made sleeping difficult. There didn't appear to be air conditioning, so the rooms were stuffy at night and we had to sleep with windows open. The rooms were large, but we did pay over 200 euro a night. The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nownownoonoo
Reviews.Content: I took my mum to Amsterdam to see Madonna at the Amsterdam Arena, so we stayed at the Hotel Vondel for two nights, and we were delighted with our room. We stayed in an executive room which was spacious and comfortable. The room had lovely high ceilings, large windows, and French doors leading out on to a small balcony. We'd requsted a twin room, but instead were given one massive bed. As mother and daughter, we were happy to share, and it was huge so we had plenty of space. The room had lots of quirky features, plus a large luxurious bathroom. The hotel was in a great location and in walking distance of most sights and attractions. If you're going to Amsterdam Arena, it costs approx 30 euros one way to/from the hotel. My only small complaint was that the housekeeping staff were fairly noisy in the mornings. I'd suggest putting your 'do not disturb' sign on your door because between housekeeping, and staff to restock your mini bar, you can have a few interruptions.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gavwaugh
Reviews.Content: The hotel Vondel is a good 20/25 minute walk from the station but perfectly situated in a nice area near to the Liedesplein which is full of bars, shops and places to eat. The staff in the hotel were amazing, always friendly, helpful and polite. The decor downstairs was in a boutique style very comfortable and classy. Breakfast was lovely with soft music , lots of choice of food and drinks and well worth the money. The rooms were fine and quiet (we were on the 5th floor though)

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: panch
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. It was walking distance to lots of clubs, restaurants and that amazing park. The museums are walkable too. The rooms are hip and trendy. Most important- the bathroom is clean and modern. They are tight and a bit cramped. Try to stay on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justusFlorence
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for romantic weekend in Amsterdam. The hotel is located in a perfect spot, near to the centre and the museums. Our room was perfect, we had airco and the bathroom had a jacuzzi. There was also a lovely garden, were we enjoyed our drinks. Breakfast was good and the staff was very helpfull to make our weekend perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Hamsons
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at this hotel at the end of our trip around Europe. Admittedly, I had high expectations based reviews, the website and the nightly rate, however this place is terrible. Whilst there are some nice design elements and friendly staff, the managements' attitudes and policies are unacceptable. We moved rooms 3 times during our stay. The first room we were given was a basement room which was dark, noisy and has incredibly low ceilings. The deal-breaker, however, was the gas from the sewage system bubbling up through the toilet and sink. After much confusion we were moved on the second day to a room at the front of the building where the building works were going on. They are renovating the facade so have scaffolding erected blocking your entire view. This room was like living on a construction site - and we were paying for it! It was noisy from 8am, it was dusty and dirty and there was no privacy. Management had kindly written a note apologising for the inconvenience and advising us to close the windows completely when leaving the room as the hotel would not take any responsibility for lost or stolen items. Unbelievably, while we were out the painters were given full access to our room to paint the windows! We returned in the afternoon to find our belongings moved, the curtains tied up and the windows all wide open to dry. When I approached the Hotel Manager to discuss this, he seemed to think this was normal practice and said that we could not expect the hotel to stay half empty while they were doing the works. It is our understanding that your hotel room is for your sole use for the period you occupy it, however this hotel believes otherwise. There was no apology, however we were moved to a third room at the back of the building. In addition to our grievances with the accommodation, other areas that management need to address are the inflated rates for bike hire and the excessively high internet rates. We have grown accustomed to being provided with free WiFi in hotel rooms and it is a shock to be charged 22 euro a day for the service. We appreciated the efforts of the staff at the front desk with our room changes and local information, but would never recommend this hotel to anyone due to the poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsSandy
Reviews.Content: We booked late so got a great deal on room 530 this was a penthouse room so couldn't really see the workmen, but heard them at 7.30am. Complained and they apologised what else can they do, we were pleasantly surprised with a good bottle of wine in our room later that day - thank you. The hotel is situated in Liedesplein within a 5 minute walk to trams that take you to central Amsterdam or the Museum quarter going the other way. Leidesplein is great for the comedy club 'Boom Chicago' and the Irish pub "The hole in the wall" does great breakfasts for under â‚¬10.00. Don't reccommend you eat breakfast at this hotel as it's â‚¬19.90. We stayed an extra hour for â‚¬10.00 but we were not charged as they said we had been inconvenienced by the workmen. Would defo come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible,”
Reviews.Author: brunalonso
Reviews.Content: Hotel terrible, dirty, the staff hinder the fourth without requesting leave. They Charger a daily that had canceled. An absurd, not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very special (but refurbishments are take place)”
Reviews.Author: tsjakka
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the center of Amsterdam, but beware at this time (june 2008) a major refurbishment is taking place of the elevators, outside building and corridors. The carpenters will start work around 08:00 AM. But, nice rooms, very good service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jfaren
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a girls weekend. room was clean and comfortable with a luxury bathroom and original art! I have stayed in some very basic hotels in the past and this was priced at about the same as some of them and much posher than I am used to! very good value and an ecellent location and I would say about 20 mins from Dam Square walking - (trams number 2,1,5 from the station). A slight mix up with breakfast - when I booked I was told in was not included, then that it was included when i booked in, then ended up paying for it! - it was a tastey one though with the usual continental/hot baffet choices and enough to keep you going until tea time. - served until 11 at weekends too - I love my lie-ins! We had a basement room, which ment two small windows to watch feet go by and a bit of street noise and noise from reception/bar area from above - however for me it was not a problem as I am used to noise and if you have had a good night out - you fall asleep anyway. - if you are a light sleeper though - bear this in mind when you book. I believe these rooms are a bit cheaper so it is really good value as they are otherwise the same standard. If you are usually a budget traveller - go there to treat yourself!

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: emmatheminx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the vondel for 2 nights at the end of march, and got EVERYTHING you expect form a boutique hotel, windey narrow corridors, eclectic decor and fantastic helpful service. Yes the rooms are quite small but they have beautiful big comfy bed's with fantastic quality furnishings. The location was slightly out of the centre but we we're where we needed to be within a ten minute walk. I would definetly recommend this hotel to frinds, and we will definetly be coming again.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to see the positive but...”
Reviews.Author: earnshaw
Reviews.Content: We always try to see the good before the bad, find the positive in the negative but the Vondel almost makes us throw that philosophy out of its boutique window! Good things about the Vondel :- Location is excellent. Cleanliness what you hope for. Not so good things :- Sound insulation absolutely non existent. We did not have to turn our television on to hear the daily news events from next doors tv. When somebody in another room walked around or placed their suitcase on the floor our room shuddered. There was no price list in the room pertaining to the costs incurred if using the 'mini bar' There was no price list in relation to breakfast, we just ended up taking pot- luck, hoping we were not ridiculously stung. At check in, because we arrived early, we were charged 20 euros to get into a room before 3.00pm. Being non - smokers it wasn't very pleasant to have the strong smell of cigarette smoke permeating from next door, down the corridors and up the stairwells into our room. Boutique is a word, generously used these days. It seems to allow for all manner of short comings; small rooms charged at overpriced rates, chipped paintwork, lack of attention to detail- price lists ...need we say anymore. The Duke and Duchess (not)

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room in universe”
Reviews.Author: Mark23Croatia
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to point out that I'm a 23 year old student, and not very demanding. I found this hotel on booking.com and booked it because it was a very good price (190 euros for 2 nights) for a hotel in the centre of Amsterdam. The receptinist was quite nice and gave me a room on the third floor. When I saw it, I was shocked! The room (with bathroom) was maybe 8 square metres (80-85 square foot) in size. Before I came to Amsterdam, I was in Brussels (NH Atlanta hotel, 2 nights-150 euros, breakfest included, unlike in Vondel hotel) where the bathroom was nearly that size. Moreover it had one bed on top of the other (I've never seen this in any hotel) like in a hostel. There was no safe in the room so I asked for another one. I moved to a room on the fourth (top) floor which was slightly bigger, but still wery small. In my country (Croatia) which compared to Holland isn't very developed there are standards that hotels have to meet in order to get a rating. One of those for instance is that if you want to have four stars on your hotel, all rooms have to be of certain size(20 square metres i think). The entire floor used to be an attic and in the hallway that led to the room there was a "mind your head" sign. I hawe no idea how they got a permission to put rooms there. All hallways are very narrow and look claustrophobic. Another bad thing was the sound insulation ore the lack of it. You can hear the TV or people talking in rooms nextdoor, you can hear every step they make. Another thing I noted that someones food was on the floor in the hallway for the entire period of my stay there. To conclude, if you dont mind the noise and prison cell sized rooms you wont have problems stayin at Vondel, otherwise avoid it at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ickled
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. However our nice experience stopped there. Walls are so thin you can feel (yes feel) people walking past the room. Originally we were placed in a stunning room, with a huge double bed and lovely bathroom with bath and shower BUT it was right next to the lift and after realising how noisy it was we asked to be moved. We were told that was fine and moved to another room, with a tiny bathroom with only a shower that flooded the rest of the bathroom and two single beds put together, single sheets and everything. We decided we would keep the second room as we thought it would be less noisy but asked if we could have the bed made up as a double. We were told that this would be done the next morning. we returned the next evening and the bed still had two single duvets etc, complained and were told again that it would be done the next morning, we returned the following evening and yip, still not done we complained again and this time we were offered a free drink at the bar while it was done there and then. We also asked the hotel if they could make reservations for dinner for us at Pasta e Baste (Its amazing) which is normally very busy. We were assured that would be fine turned up at the restaurant only to be told we had no reservation!! Luckily the restaurant had a free table, but itâ€™s was in the corner away from the entertainment. While checking out the next day I complained that our reservation hadnâ€™t been made and was asked if we got dinner when I said yes the receptionist was like oh well thatâ€™s good. No apology. Lastly we were charged for things we didnâ€™t use in the minibar, even after I had given the sheet marked with what we had used! When I queried the bill again no apology they just handed the extra we had paid over. The hotel is centrally located, it is clean and it is a nice hotel but badly run and not worth the money. Even though our complaints were delt with it just felt like the staff were incompetent and not really bothered about your stay. The only staff member who made up for this was the women who offered us a free drink while our room was being fixed. Try the NH chain for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid suprise”
Reviews.Author: Nessie1978
Reviews.Content: Being from Belgium, we are not inclined to visit nearby destinations as Amsterdam (only a 3 hour ride by car from home) But Amsterdam was full of surprises. A very vibrant, hip and beautiful city with splendid walks to discover over the little bridges over the Leidse grachten. Hotel Vondel is not a cheap hotel when you book it through their website. You should try to find a 3+1 deal with a travel agent as we did. Our room was in one word: GREAT! Loved the bathroom with bath tub AND rain shower, the room design (chocolate colours, mixed with grey and cream colours). Like the pictures in the interior design magazines. Also we had free tea and coffee in our room. Breakfast was very good. Although the little corridor where the buffet was placed, was a bit narrow. We appreciated very much the menu cards so you could order pancakes or fresh fruits, all included in the breakfast price. We were lucky and had fabulous weather too, so we did enjoy the beautiful garden with nice lounge sofaâ€™s. As top the staff, canâ€™t complain about them, except that we speak Dutch (as weâ€™re Flemish witch is the same language but with different accent) and they sometimes acted like we were speaking Hebrew. We didnâ€™t mind to be spoken to in English, but it did seem surreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: Great location, great decor, large rooms, very swanky, helpful staff - we loved it! Very modern, original art all about, lovely restaurant/lounge area. Arrived and asked for a quiet room - we got room 304, which was out the back and very quiet, but extremely small. Next day I went and asked for a bigger room (as we were staying a week) and they managed to have a larger room ready for us when we returned that afternoon. Room also faced the back (very quiet as outdoor patio closed for the season) but we could hear more noise from the hallway (slamming doors in the morning, people coming in late at night). (If you are single and want a very quiet room, room 304 or 204 would be good). Found the mini bar to be a good size for storing a few snacks and drinks. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “I Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: celine1981
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location...That's all I've got to say. Design was great (lobby, bar and rooms). Only remark: The guy at the reception was a bit snobby and not very friendly. He kept talking english to me and I'm Dutch (go figure). Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book until renovations complete!! Otherwise great.”
Reviews.Author: Sara_c_g
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived on Sun 13th Jan for a 5 night stay in the Vondel Hotel. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist who showed us to our rooms in the furthest part of the hotel from the bar etc. The room was spacious, modern and clean so we settled in for a good nights sleep. We were awoken at 7.30am by a skip getting replaced outside our window. The noise was unbearable. A letter from the management left on the table in the room told us that renovations wouldnt start until after 9am - wrong! Every morning at around 7.30 am the noise would start and continue on until the late afternoon.Another small problem was that there was a terrible stench in the bathroom - i believe this was because it was the bathrooms in the same building being renovated. The hotel bar was lovely and the art in the buildings was nice to look at. I would stay here again but now without assurances that no building work was taking place! We got the room for 79 Euros exc breakfast so it was a good deal. The location is fantastic and the beds comfortable. We were glad to get home for a good nights sleep however!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apart from renovations!”
Reviews.Author: deadviasatellite
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the bad news first and say that our hotel window opened onto a bit of a constuction site with boarding up in the area around our window. Also there was quite a bit of noise in the morning from the renovations taking place but this did happen after 9am...fine if you're an early riser but I would have appreciated being let know about this by the hotel before we arrived! However, these are the only complaints I have about Hotel Vondel. The location is excellent; just a minutes walk to the Leidseplein, the room was very spacious compared to nearly all of the European hotels I've stayed in (but we did have an executive room), decor impressive, clean and the staff very helpful. The bar was lacking a bit of atmosphere but this could have been because of the quiet time of year, but there are many other to choose from in the vicinity if you fancied something a bit livlier.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping Over Saws and Wood - But Nice”
Reviews.Author: PatentLawStudent
Reviews.Content: First, for the price we paid in that part of the city - it was a good deal. The best part, besides location were the people at the front desk - they were extremely nice. The room was also decent. I read the other reviews, but i thought all the construction was on the outside. it was not. we had to step over saws and paint buckets to get to our room during the day. It was as bad as a hallway under construction could be. Once it is done the place should be a good hotel. but they have a while until it is there. Everything else was pleasant, but I thought they would have been done with the construction.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: madmaxpaisley
Reviews.Content: top class room in a fantastic location. only one downer ...mini -bar in room a tad expensive...4.25 euro for a wee bottle of water.would recommend and come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vondel falls short.....”
Reviews.Author: Mistymonacle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vondel is well located for everything the city has to offer, the museums are on your doorstep and the famous Leidesplan is a short walk away. However, in order to sell yourself as a Boutique Hotel you need to offer a little more than great location and this is where Hotel Vondel falls flat. Yes we liked the decor and the reception / lounge ticks the box for cool cats, the bar come diner flows well with the whole public downstairs creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Initial impressions of our room were good until the walk in shower flooded the bathroom, the sink could not be filled and towels that barely covered my behind. Drop onto the great bed to have a channel surf before going out and note the telly only just rises above the end of the bed and the in house movies are unavailable. The mini bar is quite literally mini and when you wake up in the night looking for that chilled water then forget about it. You will wake up at some point because you can hear everything else that is going on in every other room in the hotel aswell as outside on the street below. The bar downstairs has massive potential but shut both nights we stayed at 12 ish and was unable to offer cocktails at the start of the evening despite having a massive cocktail list. Again a huge problem when your mini bar is empty from earlier. In short Hotel Vondel could be up there with the best but the service lets it down - lacking the personal boutique touch.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations”
Reviews.Author: tigerq
Reviews.Content: I have just spent the weekend at this hotel with my girlfriends. We booked two rooms - one triple and one twin for five of us. We orginally thought we booked the Hotel Roemer and duly arrived at the Roemer only to be told that our booking was for the Vondel. We duly went to the Vondel and were shown to a building separate from the main hotel which was undergoing renovations. The builders were working as we walked in and there was no lift in operation. We were shown to our rooms. The triple was very small and the twin was a little bigger. We weren't very happy because we had not been told that there were renovations going on and had we known at the time of booking we probably would have gone elsewhere! We complained to the receptionist Nina who very quickly sorted out two of our party with an upgraded room in the main building and agreed that we could have some form of discount from our bill. As it turned out we were not charged for breakfast and this was automatically deducted from our bill on checkout without any fuss. While I compliment Nina on her professional way of dealing with our complaint, it was a bit of a pain in the neck! If you propose to book the hotel I suggest you try and ensure that you are booked into the main hotel building. Otherwise I really liked the hotel. It is clean and nicely decorated. The area is really lovely and it is so close to the museums and shopping areas. Breakfast was lovely with an excellent choice. We ate in 15 on Friday night and in Le Garage on Saturday night. I thought that Le Garage was really great - the food was excellent and it had a great buzz mainly due to the interesting clientele and the good company I was in!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury”
Reviews.Author: laneyboo
Reviews.Content: We are just home today from Amsterdam and i'm writing the review already which should tell you something! I loved this hotel, granite sinks in the bathroom and big rain showers, the biggest bed i've slept in, so big my partner and i had a duvet each?! spacious room with couch, lcd tv and just general decadant features. The entrance and lounge of the hotel is stunning aswell. I have no fear in recommending this hotel to anyone, it is within a few minutes distance of the Leidseplein and really lives up to the 'Boutique Hotel' tag it has given itself. Minibar prices were not extortionate and the only thing i was disappointed with was that i didn't have enough nights in my trip to try dinner at the hotel restaurant as it looked and smelt fantastic. Thank-you to all at Hotel Vondel, we will hopefully be back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pleasantly pleased with hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Schnarftastic
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the not so good reviews of this hotel I was a little nervous after booking a two night stay here but I have to say I was not disappointed. I thought the location was excellent and not far from anywhere in Amsterdam (even if you wanted to walk to Central station it was only a 30 minute walk at most). First impressions of the reception and bar area were very pleasant and lived up to the 'boutique' image. I stayed in the 'seperate annex' on the 4th floor but it is not a problem not being in the main part of the building. The only negative I would comment on was the lift in this building was out of order and the stairs are very steep - but a porter carreid our cases up to the room so it was not a nig problem. I was in a twin executive which I did not find at all small, and the bathroom was very spacious compared to some hotels I've stayed in. Others in my party had a tripple executive and that was very large. The rooms were clean so no negatives there! We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly - they made restaurant bookings for us, organised taxis and helped with our luggage. Upon checkout we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room and we were given tickets as proof of ownership which were checked when we left so I felt security wasn't an issue. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time at the Hotel Vondel!”
Reviews.Author: Tata823
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and friendly. Room was very nice and clean. Stayed in a triple, which was extremely spacious. Bathrooom was spacious as well. Price was great, too. I loved the location since it was a on a quiet side street but a couple of blocks from Leidseplein, where there are tons of restaurants and bars/clubs. (Those looking to be close to the Red Light district should not stay here as it is a decent distance away although totally walkable.) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vondel”
Reviews.Author: filifjong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Just arrived from a vacation in France and wanted to spend a few days in Amsterdam on our way home to Denmark, we decided to stay at Hotel Vondel. Outside it looked very cosy and it was close to the canals and all the sights in Amsterdam. From the moment we came to the reception desk the hospitality was amazing. One of the great experiences was the beautiful room and the restaurant. The service was fantastic . We can really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vondel Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBeg
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel we stayed at is actually Hotel Vondel which I believe is affiliated/down the street from the Vondel Amsterdam - however there is not a a separate listing on TripAdvisor, so I will include here. While we were in Amsterdam we needed to find a new hotel, as we wanted to get closer to town than the Bilderberg Garden -- we saw online availably at the "Vondel Amsterdam" --however when we got to the address listed, we were at the Hotel Vondel - my husband went inside and asked if there was availability and there was (99 Euros/night) I checked out the room and it seemed fine so we took it as the rate was good compared to what we were finding elsewhere. The rooms are quite spacious althought not super lux -- the only main problem was the first night they had us in a first floor room, which is right on the street - about 7am, every person coming or going who was dragging a suitcase across the cobblesone walk (think clackety clack) made it an earlier awakening than I had hoped for (we were on vacation mode) We asked to be moved the next night, and they put us on the 3rd floor which was much quieter. As another reviewer mentioned, we were in a separate building about two doors down from the main lobby, however this didn't really bother us at all. We enjoyed the computer access they offered in the bar lobby area, and the bar was a nice place to have a drink. They also seemed to have a really nice garden area out back however it was too cool during our visit to really use it. This hotel is very close to a high end shopping street. From this hotel you can walk to the main areas (i.e. Leiseplein) in about 5 or 10 minutes, or you can just hop on the tram and get around pretty quickly. It is very close to the Vondel park which is nice to walk or ride through.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: The Vondel hotel is in a very nice area of Amsterdam and just a walking distance to the Leidseplein. Some of the rooms are extremely small and there is no air conditioning in the hotel. The rooms just have a large electric fan situated somewhere in the room. You can't open the windows much in that area of town as you'll be attacked by mosquitos and they have big ones in Amsterdam. As with many hotels in Amsterdam, they are way overpriced. Although my room was extremely small, it was very well appointed. The bathroom was also very small but functional. The breakfast was very nice but very expensive if it's not included in your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Chic and 4 Star ammenities but affordable!”
Reviews.Author: riblue
Reviews.Content: Very chic and modern decor. Room was huge, bed was even bigger!. The bathroom was gorgeous with a funky style shower and sink plus a bathtub big enough for 2! The room had nice ammenities and clean towels daily. Very comfortable layout with plenty of space. Our room faced the street and had a little sitting veranda. Hotel staff was very helpful and polite. We ate all of our meals outside of the hotel and saved a bundle.(yes, breakfast too!) Amsterdam has a lot of different cuisines and even vegetarians are catered to. NOTES: This is not a sound proof hotel. We bring our earplugs on all trips and were especially glad here since our room was next to the stairwell. Amsterdam is a party town and you will hear people on the streets at late hours. Bring earplugs to sleep and you should be fine. The sound was not an issue for us so we still give this place an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be the best”
Reviews.Author: simoma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just outside the noise but within walking distance from everything in Amsterdam. The staff is a bit cold even though helpful. Great design details everywhere in the lobby as well as in the rooms. We had a large room (de luxe) with a big bathroom. The room was clean but not tidy. Dining area and common area are great. Breakfast is good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We heart Vondel”
Reviews.Author: danzibar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vondel for the weekend and had a most enjoyable time. The Lobby is beautiful, and epitomises "boutique hotel" to a tee. The double room we chose was, admittedly, small, but the space had been used very well, and so therefore this was not a problem. The breakfast was great, the patio area was great, and the communal areas were too. The location was perfect for what we were looking for (a quiet weekend), it was close to everything it needed to be close to, and the immediate area was very tranquil, and pretty, indeed. Upon our next visit to 'Dam we shall certainly be paying the Vondel another visit. THE VONDEL ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be better...”
Reviews.Author: nosuchthing
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Amsterdam on the 25 July 207. We found the hotel staff to be very helpful and welcoming. Location was not too bad. About 10-15 minute walk to the centre of Amsterdam. My partner and I were upgraded to the XXL room for free which we found the room to be excellent. It was large with a seperate living area though the queen size bed is actually 2 single beds joined together with 2 seperate doona covers. One of the problem with the XXL room we stayed in is it is in the building next to the hotel. This meant taking your luggage through a number of doors, into a SUPER small lift (only can fit in 2 people and 1 luggage a piece). Also, as we found out later through our other friends who had stayed in the main hotel, there was no air-conditioning at all in any of the rooms. We found this to be quite annoying as even though the weather was overcast, the rooms were still fairly humid to sleep in. Also, there were no ventilation in the hallways which meant you can smell smoke throughout the rooms and hallways. Another problem we found was the noise level. The room doors tend to slam shut and you can easily hear your neighbours go in and out of the rooms. Not much positives to come out of this experience. Probably wouldnt stay here again. Overall, we have given the hotel 2 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staY”
Reviews.Author: Justfor2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location. Service was excellent! A hotel we can recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and great location”
Reviews.Author: AnastasiaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a large room 311. Beautiful interior and bathroom. Quite street. Negative - no airco and weak ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “That was a lot better”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDutch2007
Reviews.Content: Last night was my second stay at the Vondel Hotel. This time it was a lot better I must admit. I specifically asked not to have the basement room and the request was respected. This time I stayed in a suite in an adjacent building (approx 10 meter walk). This room was very spacious in every respect. It had 2 bedrooms, a seperate diningroom and livingroom and it even had a kitchen. I guess I was lucky to be upgraded :-)

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the Vondel”
Reviews.Author: Chillipeppergirl
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3-night stay at the Vondel. We were first placed in the annex (making us feel like second class citizens) in the smallest room I've ever had the misfortune to stay in. We could barely walk around the trendy but packed-in furniture, the wardrobe was tiny, the fridge wasn't working and you could only stand sideways infront of the sink. The room was so hot it was almost unbearable. It was trendy but without any thought for functionality - I'd rather have stayed in a Travelodge! After complaining the next morning, we were upgraded to a larger room at the front of the main building. The experience then could not have been more different. The room was spacious and a joy to stay in - although admittedly still very hot and as other reviewers have pointed out, noisy in the mornings. But you can't have it all. It has a lovely garden and the location was great. I'd go back (if guaranteed a large room.)

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: fetus
Reviews.Content: just got back from a short break to amsterdam. we booked the vondel hotel and had a woderful time. yes the room we had was small. but when you are only in the country for a couple of days you don't spend that much time in your room. the room was however spotlessly clean and contained everything you needed for your stay. the hotel staff where very friendly nothing was too much trouble. the hotel is easily reached from the central station by tram number one which stops 200m from the hotel. i would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar, Shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireblond
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights here at the end of April. Reasonable hotel, have had better and have had worse! We arrived quite late in the evening, after advising of a late check in. It seemed to take ages though. Plus after asking for a smoking room when booking we were given a non -smoking room deep in the basement. The decor is very dark and individual in its taste (not mine). There was very little light in there, no light outside the black wardrobe so you could hardly see what was in there. Be warned there is no air con plus a very small window that opened about 2 inches only. We were advised it was not possible to change the room that night but they would do so the day after if we left all our luggage packed. So helpful there. But on our change of room, it was still a non-smoking!!! We were very good and restrained ourselves as we realise how awful it is to get a smoking room when you wanted a non-smoking room. If the quality of the room bothers you make sure you book a better grade! On the good side, most of the staff were very friendly and approachable. The barman especially good. Great entertainment watching him work. The hotel is well located and within easy reach of the tram service and the entertainment around the leiderspein. Overall though I would try a different hotel before booking back in here.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK - But we have stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: Kezia
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed in Amsterdam, and we wll definatley be going back to Amsterdam again, we love the place and the people, but we wouldnt choose to stay at the Vondel, stayed at Banks Mansion and Dikker and Thenjs previously with canal views and highly recommmed both those hotels over this one. If I am honest there were good and bad points, but more bad than good and we have definately have had a lot better for our money. We booked direct with the hotel, for 4 adults, we requested 2 executive double rooms. When we arrived they only had allocated one room, luckily I had the email confirmation for two rooms, so eventually they managed to source a second room, after much panicking on the hotels behalf and much apologising. We were shown to our rooms which was away from the main hotel and down the street, which I personally did not like, it just didnt feel like you were staying in a hotel, just that you had paid for a room, in a hostel type building for the night.
