Our rooms we were not impressed with, they were 2 floors away from one another, and I couldnt believe that these were executive rooms, they were small, overcrowded, and overlooked a area where there was building work going on, there was builders in the hallway, with drills and hammers and I was informed later by the hotel manager that there had been a flood previously which of course they have no power over. We spoke to reception and advised that we were not happy, she said that the manager would come over and see us if we waited in the bar. Whilst in the bar we ordered drinks. 1 barcadi and coke, 1 vodka and coke, and 2 lagers and 1 coffee, it cost just short of 30 pounds, so be warned. Whilst in the bar, we chatted to a American who has a basement room, in the same building as ours and who was also not happy and waiting for his room to be changed. The manger saw us, and seemed fed up,I think it is a real problem with people changing rooms at this hotel. Having said that the new rooms which we were allocated were within the main building and were almost twice the original size, and also had a balcony - so much nicer, but just what you would expect anyway in a hotel of this standing. Reception staff that dealt with us were lovely, but the hotel itself we did not like - there was no warmth to it, it did not have a warm and welcoming atmosphere, is very oppresive in its decor as mentioned previously, decor looks nice in the photos but up close, its very cheap looking, like someone has gone in and done a 24 hour makeover, it all looks like its been done up on a really cheap budget, apart from the ensuites that is, which look like money has been spent on them. If you do decide to book this hotel make sure that you get it for a good deal otherwise dont bother , I would strongly advise that you ask for a room within the main hotel, in the same building as the bar and reception, and dont forget beware of the bar prices

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Frkpus
Reviews.Content: Perfeckt location, near Leidsplein and Vondelpark! Very nice staff. We got a room in a sepearet bulding, but that was not a problem at all! The room was very small, but cosy!!, you get what you are paying for! If you want bigger space you must pay a bit more! We are very happy with the hotel, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “No love here..”
Reviews.Author: DavidVLondon
Reviews.Content: My bad experience. I arrived at the Vondel about 10.30pm and checked in. Reception was next to the bar area and there was a lively discusussion going on about football but it was clearly one of the staff who was "effing off" three times in just five minutes. The first room I was shown too, was on the first floor, up steep stairs in an adjacent building. Stopping at the door, a mouse was struggling to gain entry, underneath! I didn't want the room so asked to, and exchanged for another. This was the style; black carpet, black curtains, a black painted wardrobe. Must have been an undergrad art design student in charge. On a first feebie job. Totally oppressive interior. The room was tiny - all furniture squeezed in so tightly that there was only just enough space to navigate around the bed. On the bed itself - four pillows, two cushions. None provided for a comfortable sleeping position either individually or as part of the set. At the base of the bed, was a furniture console/writing desk. Now, I like my feet to hang over the base so this proved to be totally impossible. So now, I have nowhere to put my feet or rest my head! I'm in a sprawl across the bed's only redeeming feature - a comfortable mattress. However, the wall mounted tv is only little more than a metre from my face and I'm hit by the vivid green brightness of the LCD display which includes the clock. I'm not going to switch it off as I am one of those people who needs to be able to see the time in the dark. So now I can't sleep on my favoured left side either. In this oppressive green tinged blackness there is additionally a constant low level electric refrigerator hum. Just as I think I'm about to get some sleep - someone enters the room above. Bang. Bang. Bang. Every footstep magnifies in my room. So too every floorboard creak. The toilet cistern flush may just as well have been my own. Then the mobile phone goes off and there's inane chat on and off over the next ninety minutes until just after two. I hear everything. EVERY LAST WORD! This is supposedly a "boutique" hotel (hah!) so why no sound deadening insulation between rooms? I do not sleep the whole of the night. In the morning, I'm seated on the loo - there's a single strand of long balck hair tapered down the tiling (not mine!). How could anyone cleaning the bathroom have missed it? I go to get breakfast - the bacon and sausage are stone cold. Enough is enough, so fellow traveller all I can say is this - you will never find me at Amsterdam's Vondel hotel ever again..

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: Wise1London
Reviews.Content: I need to be objective about this because there were some good points. - The bed was comfy, the bathroom was nice, the mini-bar wasn't massively expensive, the staff were friendly and the guy at the front desk was nice enough to provide me with a plug adapter. However, there were also some bad points which, if you refer to the other reviews are repeat offenders!! - The room was VERY VERY small. The lighting was also quite bad so, being terribly vain, I was distressed that I couldn't see myself in the mirror properly before I went out and apply my make-up properly. The thing that really annoyed me was the noise. We had come in very late and wanted to sleep in but whatever was above us starting from about 8.00am made that impossible. Like other people have said, it sounded like they were moving furniture or something and it was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO loud. It irritated me becuase I knew this had happened to some people so I emailed them in advance to specifically ask that our room was quiet. I am a pretty easy going person and normally if there was a bit of noise I wouldn't mind, but this was off the scale!!!!! - I have quite a traditional opinion that the primary purpose of a hotel room (at least most of the time) is to sleep and if you can't do this, it is redundant! Just beward of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: SpottedCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Vondel March 11-12, 2007 and enjoyed our stay very much. Our double bed was actually two twins pushed together, but the comforters were soft and pillows comfy. The bathroom was very clean and the water pressure in the shower was wonderful. Plenty of hot water, too! We ordered room service one evening and enjoyed a very gourmet looking BLT sandwich. Hotels in Amsterdam are generally very expensive, and the Hotel Vondel is quite a bargain. We booked an executive room which I recommend. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and showed us to our room upon checking in. If in Amsterdam again, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent - 14th-16th February”
Reviews.Author: Neded
Reviews.Content: Rooms are decent - Beds are comfy The bar is noisy and closes late, you sleep when bar closes You can hear all doors closing and it prevents you sleeping. Tv has little in the way of English channels Location is spot on Not enough new towels supplied Windows open fully to a nice garden area although the water feature is way too loud. It is certainly not a calming feature and sounds more like a drain unfortunately Porters brought cold soup Fridge contained out of date items

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Cozy Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Peppermint-Paty
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth visit to Amsterdam, and I have learnt by my previous mistakes and made sure I fully researched the hotel before booking. The Hotel Vondel is definitely the best hotel I've stayed in Amsterdam, especially for the price. I trawled the different booking websites and found the best prices on octopus travel.com - the price included tax & breakfast which many other websites excluded. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I opted for an up-grade to an executive room. However, be warned, Octopus quoted me an extra Â£30 per night to book this. I decided to contact Vondel hotel direct after the initial booking for the standard room had been made through Octopus and they quoted an extra 20 Euros payable upon check-out, which worked out a lot cheaper. After the first night in our room situated in the adjacent building, we requested to be moved due to the noise from the lift. The staff were helpful, and by the time we had returned that day, our bags had been moved to a room in the main building. The rooms are clean, modern and welcoming and the executive rooms are more than spacious. We opted to eat at the hotel one evening and chose the pesto pasta - a dish recommended by the head barman Dimitrius (an absolutely great & welcoming character). The food was delicious & the chef even came out to check we were happy. Breakfast was good, relaxed and not to strict on the times which is nice if you enjoy a lie in on your hols. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this place whole-heartedly - a true taste of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, But Hardly Any Space”
Reviews.Author: LOBARTIS
Reviews.Content: If you do not mind to sleep in a matchbox, this place is absolutely fine and recommendable. My single room was one of the smallest I have seen in a hotel ever, and you could hardly move inside, but with a very modern and pleasant Ikea-like decoration, though simple. The small bathroom was nice. Everything was clean and looked completely new. The bed was nice and comfortably, but too short, due to the lack of space. The location is delightful, in a pretty quiet street near the charming Vondelpark and very close to the city centre and attractions. The hotel is formed by two different buildings with a separate access, and to reach the reception and breakfast room (in the main building) from my area, you had to go out to the street, this being a bit uncomfortable and awkward. Unsuitable for travellers with a big luggage, but the overall experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Vondel mostly good”
Reviews.Author: Bartcock
Reviews.Content: Vondel was a nice hotel. Very mod and funky. Good breakfast (although the eggs are terrible-like powdered eggs). Rooms are large and well decorated as is the bathroom. Bar is cool and decent place to hang out for late night drink or refreshing beer for happy hour. Drawbacks are noise close to stairwell. People walking up periodically woke me up coming in at night. Only one small elevator so many use stairs. Also, very smoky smelling even if you have a non-smoking room. You come up stairs and its overpowering from the other rooms. I know its amsterdam but I don't expect that heavy a smoke odor. All in all, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Dark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave77
Reviews.Content: The title of this review come from the particular style of the hotel, in fact, black is the main colour for rooms, bathrooms, passages and even the christmas treeâ€™s balls. Despite this particular that could be pleasent or not, I enjoyed my stay in this hotel for the following reasons. Quality-price ratio is high because in Amstardam is quite diffucult to find a central hotel with the same Vondelâ€™s prices; great location opposite Leidesplein at the beginning of the museumâ€™s quarter; kind and young staff; clean rooms not small. However there is a negative point that I want to mention: the hotel is a 4 star category but in my opinion the right value is 3.5. I cut 0.5 points because the breakfast has not many variety of dishes, and the bathroom is rather old.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoSquirrels
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed hotel in a good location, however there were a couple of things that let it down. The first room we were shown to was extremely small, in the attic, and there was clearly building work going on right outside our room door (the carpet was covered in plastic etc. which was a little worrying). We accepted it, as the room itself though small was very comfortable and looked to have been recently done out. That afternoon we had a lie down and another guest entered our room. They had just checked in and were as surprised as us! I spoke to reception about it later and they apologised and said it would not happen again. Next morning we were woken early by construction noise, so before breakfast (which was scrumtpious) I spoke to reception and asked to be moved. She said this was not a problem - it wasn't: when we returned later in the day our bags had been moved to a different part of the hotel, a big room, with a lovely big window and very stylish black & white decor. We were really pleased with the way that they handled our complaints and the rest of our stay was great. Bar area is super stylish and we enjoyed quite a few drinks here. Check before you go that there is no construction work going on!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull location, but be aware that there is a big difference between standard dbl and executive room. Standard dbl rooms are not in the main building.There are acctually in the building 20 m from the main one , and it is horrible. Tiny elevetor, tiny rooms. But the executive rooms in the main building are great! Front desk- average.Breakfast-fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LittleClareM
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough! Hotel Vondel is situated in Vondelstraat, a quiet road about 5 minutes walk from Leidseplein. Very conveniently located for bars/clubs/restaurants/shops but quiet enough to ensure you get a good night's sleep. The staff are very pleasant and friendly and the decor is fantastic. This was my first stay in Amsterdam but certainly won't be the last, my boyfriend and I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Vondel again.

Reviews.Title: “Room Small - but perfectly formed...”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAngel99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of August. I know it was a couple of months ago but I wanted to post my comments as I think we stayed in the same room as L2003 who posted the review "Pleasant stay at Hotel Vondel but 1st room was tiny!!" We arrived at about 8am and couldnâ€™t get into our room until 2pm, however, the polite receptionists were happy to store our cases whilst we explored the city. We soon discovered everything we wanted was within easy walking distance â€“ Vondell Park, The Van Gough Museum, Heineken Brewery, Canal Cruise companies etc. When we did get into our room â€“ it was an attic room with absolutely no view. I agree it was very very small but as we were only there for two nights we decided to get cosy and stay put besides it was so clean and had lovely soft white sheets and towels. Everything about the room and bathroom was very modern and stylish. We would not hesitate to stay there again. Clean room, comfy bed, great location, polite staff and reasonable price - what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Hotel Vondel but 1st room was tiny!!”
Reviews.Author: L2003
Reviews.Content: Just back from a pleasant stay in Hotel Vondel. I booked it through venere.com and the price was quite competitive considering nothing was available for under 150e for that weekend. It was also a last minute booking and it was an Irish bank holiday so I guess lots of people were travelling. Reception check-in was a bit slow but we got sorted and were shown to our room â€“ 405 which is in the attic of the hotel and had one sloping ceiling. I think it has to be the smallest room in the hotel and I was gutted as I really wanted a nice room. I wasnâ€™t expecting anything massive but a bit bigger would have been preferred. I went back to reception looking for a new room and was told there was nothing else available in the new hotel but tomorrow they could move us. So we had to sit it out. The bathroom was so small we had to leave the door open. There was a tiny bit of room to walk around the bed but it was tight! Only one mirror in the tiny bathroom and to top it off, our â€˜double roomâ€™ was in fact 2 singles (which we are used in Europe) but these were literally 2 singles side by side and 2 tiny duvet covers that barely covered us. So a bit disappointing but still very clean, cozy and modern. The next day we got upgraded to a fabulous 2 bed apt with fully equipped kitchen and fabulous sitting room area. Itâ€™s just a pity that we didnâ€™t have this luxury for both nights or even a bigger bedroom to begin with. But, we did appreciate that they moved us and we were delighted with our new â€˜aptâ€™. Advise to other â€˜Hotel Vondelâ€™ users, ask for a room not on the 4th floor and if youâ€™re unhappy ask them to change you. The location is lovely and everything is walking distance â€“ 5 mins walk to Liesdplein, 15mins walk to Rembrandt Sq. The no 1, 2 or 5 tram brings you there from Central Station. Next time I would stay more central though somewhere near Rembrandt Sq as this is where we spent most of our time wining and diningâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Whatisleft
Reviews.Content: I travel alone quite a bit and was a little hesitant to book an independent brand. With hotel chains you know what to expect but the hotel was recommended by a very good friend of mine so I gave it a try. It was a real WOW experience. The hotel has somehow managed to blend the old with the new which keeps it from being just another trendy boutique hotel. The staff is fabulous, the atmoshere is genuine and warm and the garden is heaven. You can sit there among the flowing water and beautiful lights and just enjoy life! And for those of you who still want bacon and eggs in the morning, you are in luck. The location is fantastic; steps away from the Leisdesplein with its shops and restaurants, the heart of nightlife and shopping in Amsterdam. It is also steps away from the main shopping streets housing all the American and European designer shops. I have included photos of my room and again, not your normal decor. For only about 239 Euros, I had a large room including a sitting area, two rain shower heads in the bathroom, Espresso maker, and a bed you had to make yourself get out of each morning. And icing on the cake, a balcony where I could enjoy my coffee each morning. When in Amsterdam you must give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: oscar5
Reviews.Content: Just wish to share the excellent experience I had during my recent stay in Amsterdam last weekend. We stayed at the lovely Hotel Vondel which is fantastic located in the centre of the city. Appearantly the hotel is newly refurbished and decorated and we loved it. This is one of those great small and personal hotels that you feel immediately at home. We had a beautiful spacious room with an excellent bathroom. The decor of the hotel and room is personal, fresh, tastful and modern. The staff is very friendly and helpful and on top of all, the hotel has a wonderful garden where you can enjoy some rest in the middle of the busy city and relax. I can only highly recommend this place, should you be going to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice room, Terrible front desk organisation though!”
Reviews.Author: trendy2k
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay overall. My partner and I enjoyed a long weekend in the hotel. We had booked an Executive Room but when we went to check-in in the evening, we were told that they didnt have any available! We had read about the same issue from past visitors, so thought it best to contact the hotel to make sure we got an executive room. All was in order the day prior to our arrival. However, it seems that the front desk/reservations still were not organised. In the end we stayed in a twin room for the first night, and then moved to the correct room for the following evenings. Apart from that there werent any major problems. The hotel bars staff were very very pleasant, making cocktails for us to our requests. The front desk staff werent quite as enthusiastic though. The garden was really nice too. A japanese type garden with water features. Its nice to lie about on the large sofas outside under the sun. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. Room was gorgeous, location was excellent and very convenient and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: KrisBear
Reviews.Content: A friend of a friend booked this hotel for us. After it was booked we decided to look it up on TripAdvisor and were a bit worried with some of the reviews. We called and asked for a good room and were assured by the friendly and pleasant staff that it would not be a problem. We were even asked if we wanted a street or courtyard facing room. We had nothing but a great experience from check-in to check-out. Our room was lovely. The staff were extremely helpful when it came to suggestions of where to go, places to eat, etc. Even arranging reservations for us. The bar in the hotel was wonderful too, with a relaxing terrace in the back. And the location was perfect. Walking distance to boat tours, Vodel park, the Van Gogh museum, downtown core, etc. We had an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Way out of our league”
Reviews.Author: jeninbrighton
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic - in a great location (near Leidseplein), so beautifully decorated, and outstanding service. I took my boyfriend here for 2 days for his birthday in May. I only booked the place because it had good reviews, and was in my budget. I wasn't expecting it to be as fantastic as it was when we arrived. The rooms and the lobby/dining area were obviously decorated by a high-profile designer, and look like something out of a magazine that you only wish your house could look like. Because we arrived very late at night, the room we were given was (apparently) smaller than the one had booked. We were in awe of the room, so didn't notice(!) until the man from the desk phoned us to say that they were giving us breakfast for free during our stay because of the room mix-up. The breakfast was a-maz-ing. Soooo good. I paid much more on our last trip to stay in the NH Amsterdam, and this hotel is much, much nicer. I will be staying at the Vondel on all my trips to Amsterdam from now on!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCAM
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! We read all the reviews and were very curious what to expect! But is was great. The room was not big but had a very nice and efficient design. The bathroom had a rain shower. The breakfast / bar area is very cosy and the staff is great! Very personal service. The location of the hotel is perfect, near to the Rijksmuseum and the Leidse square.

Reviews.Title: “In general a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: logios
Reviews.Content: Having read all the previews reviews I was relactunt about my stay in Vondel hotel. I was positively surpriced by the outcome. The hotel was excellent placed close to the centre and main tram stations. The breakfast was excellent and the people were very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice although small and quite noisy because of the walls. We had to walk outside to get in the main building again but it was nothing bad. In general the hotel served well and the ratio price/service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNTgermany
Reviews.Content: we read all the reviews on this site and we were a bit worried! we emailed them asking for a nice room and we got a quick response saying that they will make sure we get a nice room. Indeed we ended up with a great room that was large compared to other hotel rooms. Very clean and the location was great. walking distance to everywhere. We will always go back to this hotel. very modern and funky and has everything that a four star hotel can provide.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm nomally pretty easy going when it comes to hotels, but this place was the pits. Just a few of the problems -- the hotel is VERY noisy, there's no airconditioning in the room, the bathroom had the previous occupant's used amenities, the lighting in the room was poor, electronic room key didn't work properly, the ground floor rooms offer very little privacy from street traffic, the breakfast buffet was infested with bugs...couldn't wait to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Queen's Day in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chasUpstateNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vondel on Queen's Day weekend (end of April) this year. I was happy to get any room as I had not planned on being in Amsterdam till the last minute. The city is FULL so book ahead. The anex at the Vondel (the site a few meters further east on Vondel St) is just as described: Decorated (if you can call it that) in black paint and purple carpets. The hallway is indeed scary when you first enter. The room, however, was quite workable. I had a comfortable double bed and a nicely done bathroom. On Friday evening there were quite a few party people on Vondel street, so it was tough to sleep. On Saturday night, I was too tired to notice anyone eles's noise. Usually I stay at the Marriott, near by, and usually pay no more for the best room at the Marriott, but for Queen's Day, I was happy for any bed in the center of the city. The only other choices were out by the airport. For a low enough price, the Vondel could be a good value. At 200 Euro a night, it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in December 2005. The location was excellent; it was about 2 minutes walk from town. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the first night we stayed in one of their double rooms. We were woken up at 6am by renovation work being carried out in the room next door to us. I went to reception to complain, but before I could start complaining they handed me a key to one of their luxury apartments and were extremely apologetic. Their rooms were very clean and warm. As for the beds, they were just like sleeping in clouds. I cannot recommend this place enough. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think so....”
Reviews.Author: dickyBristol
Reviews.Content: Staff absolutely fantastic along with location, but i have to mention the decor which is a throw back to the eighties very black and white which just gives the rooms etc a dull and uninviting appeal - i think we had about 5 lights on constantly. Must admit the lack of a shower curtain was a bit of a stress - water will go everywhere - okay for a wet room but guess what it isn't. The hand basin in the room is one of these ultra trendy things, but be warned you cannot fit your hands full under the tap - i think design took over from practicality. Last thing dont drink at the bar unless you like getting seriuosly ripped off a whiskey and a glass of wine will set you back 20 euros. In the UK we are used to a small glass of wine being 175 ml in this bar it's more like 20ml at triple the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having booked a room at Vondel, I read the good and bad reviews on this site and decided to e-mail the hotel asking for a nice room. I quickly got a very friendly reply, assuring me that I would get a nice room. The first impression of the hotel was very possitive and the room we had booked was beyond expectations! It was spacious, modern decorated and clean. The staff was great as well as the location. The breakfast was one of the highlights of every day we spend in the hotel! I felt I got good value for the 200 Euro's I paid per night. I would for sure return to this hotel again and I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone who would be going to Amsterdam. I have included some photo's of of the hotel and our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews we were a litle nervous when we turned up. The reception is modern and staff really helpful. The room they gave us was out of the main hotel and down the street a few yards. We went in a door and I thought we had taken the wrong door and gone into a brothel. The coridor was dirty, smelly, narrow and it felt unsafe. However we went to the room which was clean and tidy but really small. The room was also on the slant everything was leaning including the bed. No way I could sleep there. Back to reception. At reception they immediately gave us another room. This one was in the basement. Dark, small and the window was looking out onto the steps of the kitchen which were covered in cigarette butts. Being a non smoker there was no way we could have opened the window. Back to reception. The thrid room was on the 3rd floor, twice the size of the others. It had been recently redecorated and had a new bathroom. The bathroom had no towel rail or shower screen. The sink, although modern was only an inch deep with no overflow. Be careful. Room was still slanted but only slightly this I assume was an upgraded room. The hotel overall is not a 4 star as rated. Resonably comfortable but not in anyway luxurious. Staff are very good, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is excellent. Location is brilliant, close to the Leidesplein (300M). Summary..... Nice friendly hotel. If you are in a nice room you'll enjoy it. Not luxurious and for the money I paid I'd look around. Drop the price and I'd definately go back if I had the right room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel as I had read a few bad review of it but I was worrying about nothing. This hotel was perfect for a 4 day break with my boyfirend for his 30th birthday. The hotel is very clean and tidy, staff are friendy- especially restaurant staff- and really efficient, the place is full of amazing pieces of art and our bedroom (401) was amazing with little sky lights in the bathroom, beams painted black and really spacious and comfortable with a wicked little TV- I loved it. The location is also excellent as it is so near to Leidesplein where most of the restaurants, bars and coffe shops are. Also so close to the Van Gogh and Rembrandt museum. To give you an idea it is a few second away from the town centre Marriott. Breakfast is great - continental and English, loads of fruit and anything you could want. Mini bar is amazing and pretty cheap too with loads of drinks and snacks.. Anyway, I think I've raved about it enough, definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Liked my stay at the Vondel very much. The room was small however everything was new and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and the location is perfect. I had a very nice stay. I will for sure go back to this hotel when I am in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could of been better”
Reviews.Author: Choco1
Reviews.Content: Having read several reviews some of which were mixed i was hoping the better ones would be a true reflection of this hotel. Hotel Vondel is different as it is split over two buildings and you need to leave the main reception building to get to some of the rooms. The main building is nice, cool contempory interiors and a quiet atmosphere. The hotel is in a good location, a quiet street just off one of the main sqaurea and 2 min walk to a tram stop which will take you anywhere in Amsterdam. The rooms are also nice but not ideal if you don't want to have to leave the main building and go up the street to get to your room. The first night we stayed in a room overlooking the street. The room was nice and had a balcaony however come 7 am there was noise in the street and this woke us up so we asked to move to a room at the back. We were moved but the room was smaller all be it quieter. In essence, Hotel Vondel is ok but not perfect. The building we stayed in was being decorated and there were painters in the corridors and the carpet looked liked it needed a good hoover. It is modern and different but not for those whoo are looking for a traditional luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars your having a laugh!!”
Reviews.Author: Steveracer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vondel, 4 Starâ€™s you got to be having a laugh. Bad Experience for us Iâ€™m afraid.Having searched through tons of hotels on the net we plumped for this one. From the majority of trip reports it looked good. The fact that it was also advertised as 4 Star Hotel made our minds up. On the website â€˜Easy to Bookâ€™, it clearly states and I quote â€œHotel Vondel has 67 Modern (?) comfortable and attractively decorated roomsâ€�, it goes on â€œCharacterized by its unique interior design.All rooms provide outstanding comfort and convenience for both business and leisure travellerâ€�. This could not be further from the truth with what we experienced. On arriving at 14.45hrs our room was not ready. Not to worry we booked in and went for something to eat. Around 16.00hrs we returned. The staff were friendly and gave us the pass to the room. Up we went to the top floor. When the lift door opened it seemed that we were in the attic, we were met with building works going on. The main carpet was covered with another covering to protect it but this had crumpled up causing tripping hazards all along the entire length of the floor. A short turn left and we found our room, 404. Not sure what the other rooms are like but beware this room is dreadful. Remember the quote about attractively decorated rooms, outstanding comfort and unique interior design. Maybe our expectations are too much for a supposedly 4 Star hotel. The room was seriously small. With hardly any room to swing a cat, or put your suitcase. The decor was truly awful, dull and dreary like something from the 1950â€™s. One very small window let in the light but on looking out of it you looked straight into the skylight on the roof of the house next door. Another long thin window behind the TV that was on the wall had dark curtains drawn and was very awkward to get at, to even open the curtains let alone look out of it. The room had No Heating yet in the text it quotes about Comfort. The head board had these strange rings coming out of it, â€˜whats that all about!â€™ the mind boggles. We sat and chatted about the fact we were not happy with what we had found. In the end we decided that enough was enough already. The fact that major building maintenance was taking place outside our room, told us the floor should not be in use, the room itself was No way near Comfortable as stated. And this really put us off of the rest of the hotel. We went off and looked into another hotel. With room's available we went back to the Vondel and checked out. The staff member asked us to reconsider and to look at 1 more room they had available. This room turned out to be a flat next door to the Hotel and right at the top of the building. The place had no lift and my wife had to use her inhaler on reaching the top. This room/flat although being much bigger was still not suitable due to the stairs leading up to it. On returning to the Vondel we found ourselves offered another room, by another member of staff who seemed to take over from the guy who was dealing with us, yet we had been told previously there was only 1 more room available. At this point we again stressed that we wanted to go. Then the fun and games started. The new member of staff then said we would have to pay full price despite only being there just over 2 hours. I queried this by asking are you seriously going to charge us full price for a sub standard attic type room on a floor level that clearly should not be in use. Now, we expected to pay something but not full price! I said Iâ€™m sorry I cannot understand that, the hotel is clearly not as stated. Showing and quoting from the paperwork I had taken from the website advertisement. Again I was told we would have to pay full price. Fine I said but when I get back Tripadvisor will get a full report. And that may affect future clients for the Hotel. I said that I would also inform the Dutch Tourist Board of the situation and could they give me the address. The next bit amazed us. The hotel staff member told us that they did not have the address for the Dutch Tourist Board and they did not know it!! On saying that he then gave us our check out papers and said Iâ€™ve checked you out. I offered the money and he declined!! Saying I have checked you out I hope your next Hotel is better than this one, what he did not know was we had been to the 5 Star Marriot on the corner and booked in there, cost us a lot more but boy was it worth it for some comfort. Why when we offered the money did they suddenly refuse, was it something to do with us mentioning The Dutch Tourist Board!! we will never know. Keep away you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying here, as I had read some great reviews, and the pictures I had seen of the hotel looked nice. It didn't disapoint when we got there. The main part of the hotel (reception/bar area) was really nice and classy. However when we were taken to our room, we had to go outside to get to it, as it was in a different part of the hotel, which unfortunately, wasn't as nice. The room was quite small, but had all the essentials. I would stay here again though, but would like to of had a room in the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel for all”
Reviews.Author: DanielMinks
Reviews.Content: As others have stated in previous reviews, I arrived at the hotel with my girlfriend unsure of what to expect, mixed reviews on this hotel had left my imagination confused and my hands a bit shaky. I can with complete honesty that I was extremely satisfied with all aspects of the hotel. Staff were friendly, the decor was certainly not tasteless as stated in a previous review, in fact I found the stay refreshing relaxing and immensely pleasurable. Ok yea you could smell a bit of pot when wandering through the corridors at night but what do you expect in Amsterdam. The location is perfect central, but tucked away in a secluded and very Dutch feeling street. You are around a 3 minute walk from central restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc and between a 5 â€“ 10 min stroll from the main museums. I got a very good deal on this hotel, if I had paid 185 Euros for the night as stated in another review my report may not be quite so shining, but the good deals are out there, and this hotel has everything you could possibly expect from a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Taste ripp off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 185 Euro, Ex Breakfast for a room so small that we had to plough through our own luggage to reach the toilet. During nights heavily smelling of Pot and also extremely noisy. Obscure hooks at the end of the bed, indicating some sort of... well... Dont go to this awkward place, that pretends to be "trendy", but still only has one choice of (expensive) wine that tastes somewhere inbetween balsamic vinegar and window cleaner. Staying in this place makes you feel cheap...

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't return to VONDEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i booked hotel vondel for a weekend break in late december for my girlfriends birthday. it was ok but nothing like the website,rooms were in need of decorating and we had to come out of one building and walk 4 doors up to the reception.its not to bad unless its 2 am when you find theres no tea and coffee in room as promised.staff were very nice but its just not a 4 star. never never. for an extra Â£30 per night you can book golden tulip 5*

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!"”
Reviews.Author: odense
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review because I was worried about the reputation of Vondel and the older comments of the hotel on this site, but the Vondel understands service in a way that cool hotels usually neglect. I am in Amsterdam often and I have tried to find the hotel that would make my stay feel less like work and more like pleasure. I had a room on the top floor facing the garden and it was utterly silent up there and I slept brilliantly on the beautifully comfortable bed. The room was elegant with original beams, painted glossy black! The bathroon was lovely with a window facing the sky! I used the Wifi every day, had a few drinks in the bar, a really pleasant and cosy bar and I enjoyed the breakfast very much every morning. The staff is gracious and smart. The hotel has many shops and restaurants within minutes from the hotel. The location is the best you can get in Amsterdam. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i needed a place to stay the night in Amsterdam before catching a plane. We hadn't booked anything beofre getting to Amsterdam but had passed by the Vondel Hotel on a previous stay and thought it looked quite nice. So we went in and they did give us a great rate since we were last minute and even threw in free breakfast. however, even at a deeply discounted rate it was not worth staying here. the rooms are built beneath street level, which make them quite noisy as you can hear people walking on the street and then people above you, since the lobby and the bar of the hotel are upstairs. The first room they gave us, when we walked in the carpet was flooded, since it had been raining all day. We asked for another room, which was dry although the carpet in the hallway outside was quite wet. We went to dinner and when we came back there was a very loud whirring noise reverberating throughout our room. When we checked with the staff they didn't seem to know anything about the noise, so we had them come to our room and listen. After some discussion they admitted that they had turned on a pump to keep the water out of the hotel. We asked to change rooms again. They then moved us next door to their apartments. The apartments were in bad shape and in need of updating. They just weren't very nice. While the staff were accommodating about moving us, i felt that we shouldn't have had to move three times in the first place. It seems like there are nicer places to stay in Amsterdam and so i wouldn't waste your time with the Hotel Vondel. It looks very nice from the outside, but once you scratch the surface there are a lot of flaws with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Becoming Better”
Reviews.Author: 2BAnonymous
Reviews.Content: First off, know that the Hotel Vondel is currently undergoing renovations. If you are at all set off by the slightest inconvenience, then this is not the time for you to stay at the hotel. Wait a few months, then, and you will be pleased. I stayed at the Hotel Vondel for six nights at the beginning of November 2005. Although the renovations are nearing an end, the hotel changed each day. It was like a new surprise each time I crossed the threshold. Parts of the mid-renovation efforts looked crummy and were a bit unpleasant, but it is a work in progress. When it is all complete, this will be a top notch little boutique hotel. I scored it as above average because it is - even a bit disheveled during renovations - a good little hotel for a decent price. I can only imagine what it will be when it is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Amsterdam hotels”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Great location,clean and neat room. Got upgraded to the executive suite without asking.. nice staff.. very welcoming and polite. Service was great in comparison to typical bad dutch service. The room had no info about the hotel or services, no bath robes even though it was advertised as having them. Bear in mind this is a 4 star hotel according to dutch standards. Would stay there again aon a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Was quite pleased with the Vondel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is clean, in a good location, 15 minute walk to dam square. There is plenty to do nearby. Be careful with the hotel advance charge to your credit card (but apparently this is a law in the netherlands!?) At least an extra 50 euros per night for authorisation. I wasn't aware of this in the booking. Our room was one of the smaller ones, but had a flat screen television. Building work is still going on and there was abit of loud noise in the early morning from 9am by the builders. Mini bar is a bit pricey, other than that we enjoyed our 2 night stay at the hotel. P.s Watch out for the trams!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent one week in this wonderful hotel. The hotel was not something like a standard [which means rather steril business hotel] which - by the way - makes me sick. Hotel Vondel is a 'warm' place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst!”
Reviews.Author: hildynyc
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and my client booked this hotel for me. And I didn't want to seem ungrateful..... but it was sooooo bad that I requested to move to another hotel. The internet (kinda important for business travelers) rarely worked. And although they have said they renovated, it certainly wasn't sound proofing. And they are STILL renovating! I could hear noise from the hallway, the lobby (I was on the second floor, around a corner!), really loud music from the outside "garden" and bar downstairs, other rooms, etc. And when I finally complained, they didn't seem to know what to do. I was without internet for 2 day! I wouldn't recommend this hotel and now, neither will my client. Definately not a value!

Reviews.Title: “Bad attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned hotel and our junior suite was fine, but we had three bad experiences. First, on returning to our room on the evening of our first full day it had not been made up, nor had a television fault I had reported been attended to. Second, we were given no warning of the re-carpeting that would take place outside our room on the Monday morning. Third, our double room had two single beds pushed together rather than a double. I have experienced this before in hotels, but rarely in a 4 star hotel. Further, we did not even have a double duvet, but instead two singles. This was equivalent to sleeping in separate beds. Not great for a weekend away from the kids! We got a deal well below rack rate, which was some comfort, but would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights before leaving for Italy and enjoyed my stay very much. The night before checking in I was reading the reviews above and I must say that i cant understand the complaints, because I had a wonderful experience. With the nice staff and great location, nice decorated rooms and good service, I can only rate with an "excellent", when comparing this hotel with the service, the rooms and room rates of other hotels in which I stayed in Amsterdam before (maybe an hoax??).

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thought this was a 4 star hotel. Room size disappointing. cleanliness not up to 1 star standard. Heating out of control, had to lie on bed with wet towel to stay cool. Building works going on in other part of hotel that were not mentioned on internet. ? 4 star. Staff OK Thought I was going mad so did my boyfriend, the room was actually on a slant. Woke up at 3:30 in the morning and found MICE in our room. We were offered another room but declined. Hotel gave full refund. We checked out in early hours found a GREAT hotel called the American hotel. 5 star hotel and cheaper than the Vondel. Thankyou American - you save our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, well cleaned and a spacious. I must say i had the biggest room, the Executive room, for the same price as the superior room, for what reason i dont know. The roomservice aint what u are lookin for if u want luxurious diner. I will strongly recommend you to not order any food in this hotel. Besides that......... But the location of the hotel is excellent. 2 min walk to the park, and 3 min walk to some great restaurants clubs and what else u are looking for :) I read this site's comment before i went, and had a bad feeling when i did. But none of the complaints applied when i stayed. The staff is really friendly, and are willing to help you with your questions. After all i had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the hotel â€“ liked the location and the room very much â€“ would go back next time when visiting Amsterdam Thnksâ€¦
